loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is borrowing a new loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.  Her general store business was previously funded through NWTF.  Kiva continues to provide for Gemma and her family with an increased income in order to uplift their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, 26 years old, is married and has 1 child. She describes herself as ambitious. For the past 4 years, Lucy has operated a retail store where she sells clothes. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are the general public. Lucy describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use this KES 10,000 loan to add to her stock of clothes. 

Lucy's business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be financially stable. This is Lucy's second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 10,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add to her stock of clothing

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 41-years-old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Salvacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles, and school supplies. 

In the future, Salvacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food market business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall. Teresita successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Teresita's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of spices and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Teresita has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Jenny Rosario

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 29 años, es madre soltera,  tiene un hijo de 1 año que es su motor de fuerza para seguir adelante. Viven en Santo Domingo en casa de su madre, quien tiene un pequeño taller de costura. Jenny se dedica a la elaboración de bocaditos y pasteles, los mismos que vende en las afueras de escuelas y mercados, además entrega para fiestas y eventos.
En su actual negocio cuenta con tres años de experiencia, ahora tiene el sueño de emprender en la venta de sandalias para  contar con más ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su pequeño, para ello necesita capital, es por eso que acudió a Fundación Alternativa por hacer realidad su sueño,  con el crédito podrá comprar sandalias para vender a los clientes que visitan su casa, además para salir a recorrer los fines de semana. Está muy emocionada y agradecida con Kiva, quien le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Jenny is 29 years old. She is a single mother and has a 1 year old son who  is the motor of strength that drives her forward. They live in Santo Domingo in her mother’s house who has a small seamstress shop. 

Jenny works making snacks and pastries. She sell them outdoors at schools and markets and delivers them to parties and events. She has 3 years experience in her current business but now she has the dream of selling sandals in order to have more income and thus improve the quality of life for her and her little one. She needs capital for this and this is why she came to Fundación Alternative to achieve her dream. 

With the loan she will be able to buy sandals to sell to customers that visit her home and to take out to sell on weekends. She is very excited and grateful to Kiva for helping her to improve her income.

loans.use: to start a business selling sandals

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a loving and hardworking mother of two children (sons).  She is 26 years old and completed a secondary education.  She lives with her two sons and husband Gopal, 30 years old, in the small village of South Moumari in Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. They have a kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo made).  Kalpana's husband Gopal attended school up to class IX (Grade 9).  He is a newspaper vendor.  He delivers daily newspapers from door to door in his locality.  One of their sons is a student in the primary standard and the other is below the school-going age.

Kalpana always prioritizes her children's future, which is why she has not gotten tired of doing things to give them a better way of life.  Kalpana has her grocery store within the locality, where biscuits, bread, butter, spices, flour and other kinds of grocery items are sold. She has chosen this business as there is no other grocery store in her locality.

Now she aims to improve her grocery shop due to the increasing demands of her customers. But to expand her business, she needs capital.  So she applied for a loan from BJS to buy grocery items to meet the demands of her customers and at the same time, improve her financial stability and impart a proper education to her children.

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Kornobala

texts.en:
Kornobala is a 41-year-old woman. She is an entrepreneur. She has two children.  The oldest son works as a mason, and the only daughter studies in secondary school (grade 9). Kornabala is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband, Profulla, aged 45 years, is also illiterate. They live in their own house in the small village of Nirendrapur in Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Kornobala in her childhood received training on how to prepare incense. Using that skill, now she is preparing incense and supporting her family. Her husband also assists her in this business. For many years, Kornobala has been involved in this business.  

The area in which she lives is very suitable for her business. The local people, her neighbors and friends are her customers. Moreover, the raw materials used in making incense sticks are easily available, and it is a profitable business, too. She is always looking for ways to generate revenue and support the household.  

Kornobala prepares incense and sells it to the local shops and in her neighborhood, but these days the prices of the raw materials are increasing rapidly; as a result, they are not getting sufficient profits as expected. So, it becomes difficult for them to run their family well.

Kornobala has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to buy the raw materials (sticks, perfume, etc). Her plans are to expand the quantity and quality of her products to get more customers. At the same time, she can earn more profits. In this way, she can give financial support and educate her daughter in a better way. The profits will also help her to expand her business and fulfill all her dreams.

She thanks BJS and Kiva for giving her the loan.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials (sticks, perfume, etc.) to expand her existing business of making incense sticks.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 38-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. Her sewing machine is out of order which is needed to be replaced with a new sewing machine.

However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She intends to use this loan amount to buy a new sewing machine to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. 

She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for the tailoring business.

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
Vanny, 30, lives in a rural village in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She is a married mother of seven children, four of whom are still in school. Her family earns its income from leasing a rice paddy. Vanny has been making a living in this business for 15 years, and currently earns about KHR 58,000 per day, of which she manages to save about KHR 25,000 for future needs.

Vanny has been with VisionFund for eight cycles. She completely repaid her past loans which helped her to better support her family. She is now leading her group to request a loan. Vanny is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children, and she is motivated to provide her family with quality food and clothing and to make sure that they are all healthy.

To earn a living, she has been running a small general store with her husband out of their house. She has three years of experience in this field. Her husband purchases stocks of goods from the market because he has developed many contacts over the years.

She is now hoping to grow her business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy packs of flour, rice, biscuits, and beverages to meet her customers' increasing demands. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings as a result of the loan, and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy inventory for the grocery store.

loans.name: Made

texts.en:
Made feels very happy. She can make all her plans and dreams happen.  She sold all the piglets at a satisfactory price and earned a profit. Now she can carry out her dreams of improving her kitchen, saving money and fulfilling the needs of her family. 

Entering the new year, her children need new equipment for school. Each day, her children have to travel a distance of 6 km to go to school. So, Made needs to pay transportation costs in addition to the cost of books and other school needs. For that reason, Made decided to continue lending with the same loan amount. Currently, her sows have already given birth to 20 piglets and Made bought a new sow with her last profit. Now she has eight sows. Her loans are used only for the purchase of feed and vitamins. She wishes that her business will run smoothly and that she can meet the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El Sr. Oscar tiene 53 años, está casado con la Sra. Delia tienen tres hijos, uno está casado y los otros dos estudian Medicina y Derecho, son personas de bien que sirven a la sociedad.
El señor Oscar trabajó en un taller de joyería  en donde aprendió todo sobre trabajos de joyería ganando experiencia, un día decidió independizarse, y abrió para su propio taller de joyería, dando trabajo también a sus hijos. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de joyas. Independientemente de tener también una ferretería en su casa, el cual administra su esposa. En el futuro le gustaría  montar un depósito de materiales de construcción.
Pide de este préstamo para poder comprar plata para hacer cadenas, anillos, aros, pulseras, dijes, etc. Agradece por esta oportunidad que él está recibiendo.
texts.en: Oscar is 53 years old and married to Delia.  They have three children, one is married and the other two are studying medicine and law.  They are good people who serve society.  Oscar worked in a jewelry shop where he learned all about the jewelry business and gained experience.  One day, he decided to become independent and opened his own jewelry shop, and also gave his children jobs.  Currently, he is engaged in selling jewelry.  He also has a hardware store in his home, which his wife manages.  In the future, he would like to open a construction materials warehouse.  He is requesting this loan to purchase silver to make chains, rings, earrings, bracelets, charms, and other jewelry.  He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase silver to make chains, rings, earrings, bracelets, charms, and other jewelry

loans.name: Choep

texts.en:
Choep, age 46, is a widowed mother. She lives in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has five sons and four daughters. Three of them are married, two are garment workers, another two attend school, and one stays at home. Another of Choep’s daughters has a business of wedding planning decoration.  She wants to buy fabric to tailor more traditional clothes; that will assist in her business. 

Hence, Choep decided to apply for a loan to help finance her daughter. 

Photo: Choep is standing with a big smile.

loans.use: To buy fabric for her daughter to tailor more traditional clothes.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El Sr. Pablo tiene 69 años de edad, está casado con la señora Efemia  de 63  años y tienen dos   hijos mayores con sus respectivas familias, que gracias al esfuerzo de ambos, hoy ya son personas de bien, útiles a la sociedad.
Desde joven el Sr. Pablo se dedicó a distintos tipos de trabajo, y con el predio de lote que tiene,  tuvo la idea de  comprar vacas para poder vender leche, y hoy día ya cuenta con una clientela formada ya de varios años. Además de eso también hace trabajo de fletes, pues tiene un camión de cargas. 
Le gustaría para el futuro poder comprar máquinas para la elaboración de yogurt ya que es un buen negocio y es muy rentable por la zona.
Pide este crédito para la compra de vacas, que le permitirá seguir con su producción, y también seguir luchando por los ingresos para la casa.
texts.en:
Pablo is 69 years old and is married to Efemia, who is 63 years old. They have two adult children who now have their own families. Thanks to their efforts, their children have grown up to be good people who contribute to society.

Since he was young, Pablo has worked at different types of things. The parcel of land he has gave him the idea of buying cows to sell milk. Now he has had an established customer base for a number of years. In addition to this work, he has a cargo business, because he has a delivery truck. In the future he would like to buy machines to make yogurt, because it is a good business and is very profitable in his area.

Pablo is requesting this loan to buy cows, which will allow him to continue with his milk production and to continue working to earn income for his household.

loans.use: to buy cows to produce milk.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa se encuentra reingresando al grupo de crédito Damas Responsables  grupo al que ha pertenecido 9 años, le gusta esta forma de créditos por la solidaridad y compañerismo¸ vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada como la tercera ciudad más importante del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente aún mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora Rosa tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 20 y 9 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, su segundo hijo está estudiando en una escuela de la localidad.
Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo y le va muy bien, también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos y ropa. Su meta es continuar creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en: Rosa is re-entering the “Damas Responsables” [Responsible Ladies] communal bank, a group that she has belonged to for nine years.  She likes this form of credit because of the solidarity and camaraderie.  She lives on the outskirts of Cuenca, which is considered to be the third most important city in the country.  It was declared a World Heritage Site in December, 1999 and the people still maintain their culture and traditions.  Rosa is 42 years old, and a single mother of two children, ages 20 and 9.  Her first child, a daughter, is married and lives on her own and her second child, a son, is a student at the local school.  Rosa sells clothing by catalog and it’s going very well.  She also sells cosmetics.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of cosmetics and clothing.  Her goal is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a computer game business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy an additional unit for her computer game business.

Delia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Delia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit for her computer game business.

loans.name: Denia Merari

texts.es: Denia tiene 31 años de edad, vive en el municipio de San Francisco de Yojoa junto a su conyugue y sus tres hijos. Hace mas de 5 años que Denia se dedica a vender mercadería en la comunidad, vende jeans, blusas, zapatos, sandalias, productos Avon etc.  El negocio lo tiene en su casa y sale a vender de manera ambulante a domicilio y por pedidos. Esta solicitando un tercer préstamo que es por 21,000 Lempiras para comprar más mercadería como ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y surtir para aprovechar en esta temporada navideña donde logra incrementar las ventas.  Su meta es trabajar mucho para mantener estable el negocio y obtener el ingreso necesario para la unidad familiar.
texts.en: Denia is 31 years old and lives with her husband and three children in San Francisco de Yojoa.  Denia has been selling merchandise in the community for more than five years.  She sells jeans, blouses, shoes, sandals, Avon products, etc., and has her business in her home, she sells on foot and on order.  She is asking for her third loan in the amount of 21,000 Lempiras to buy more merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and cosmetics to stock up and take advantage of the Christmas season when she wants to increase her sales.  Her goal is to work a lot so she can maintain a stable business and obtain the income she needs for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: 09.02.3 Phú Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Ngân is 49 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents. Her children are grown up.

Ngân has a retail business selling mobile phones. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Ngân faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

She is requesting a loan to buy mobile phone cards and cell phones to resell. In 2012, Ngân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ngân is the group leader of the 09.02.3 Phú Sơn 3 solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

With her business profit, Ngân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone cards and cell phones to resell.

loans.name: 01.05.13 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hòa operates a food stall/restaurant selling soup. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

Hòa is 60 years old and she is married with no children.

Hòa is the group leader of the 01.05.13 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of three members.

She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, and has no dependents

This is Hòa's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

Hòa has been involved in this business for eight years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hòa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is married and has three school-aged children. She has a snack vending business and a farm to till that supports the family for their daily needs. Recently, she applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy farm inputs. She hopes that their family will live comfortably with enough savings in case of emergency.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more vegetables and fish for her business and it also helped in the education of her children. Her income from her business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to pay for more vegetables and fish she needs in her business. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Brenda hopes to have more loyal customers and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more vegetables and fish needed for her business.

loans.name: Zeus

texts.en: Zeus is married with one child and operates a service-based business while his wife works as a public teacher in their village. He has been providing motorcycle transportation for more than a year and he earns enough for their daily needs. He took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy a new set of tires. He wants to improve the general living conditions of his family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Monodini

texts.en:
Monodini is a 34-year-old rural woman.  She is married to Mukundo, who is 42 years old.  Monodini is illiterate and can only sign her name. Mukundo received an education up to class V (Grade 5). They have only one son who is a student in class XI (Grade 11). They live in the small village of West Tekatuli in Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own house.

Monodini is a housewife and her husband is a mason by profession. He is very tenacious and dedicated to his job. With his small income, they try to cover some home expenses and their children's educational expenses. But these days, they are unable to meet the increasing expenses of their family.

She learned about BJS and applied for a loan to purchase a cow to start a milk supply and dairy products business, producing items such as butter, paneer, curd etc. She wants to sell them in the local market.  Her main interest is to continue fighting for her family's well-being and to give a proper education to her son.  For that reason, she will continue to work hard in order to make her dreams come true.

In the future, she wishes to purchase more cows with the profits. She gives thanks to the lenders at BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is a 39-year-old woman from a rural area. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. She is married to Bamaprosad and together they are raising four children (two sons and two daughters). Three of her children are going to school (Grade 12, Grade 9 and Grade 5, respectively)  Their oldest son is engaged in a shoe-making business. They are from the remote village of Tekatuli in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri and have their  own small kachha house (mud and straw made).

Parbati is very hard-working.  She is also a very visionary and enterprising woman, which is why for the past five years, she has been working as a daily laborer under a building contractor to assist her family by giving them financial support. But her small income is not sufficient to cover the household needs and the educational expenses of her children.  Now she has decided to start a new business by supplying milk.

She applied for a loan from BJS to purchase a dairy cow to start her business. Her customers will be her neighbors.  She will deliver milk from door to door in her locality. She has chosen this business because there is a huge demand for milk in her area.

Her goals are to give her children a good upbringing, upgrade their financial condition and purchase one more cow in the future with the profits earned from this business.

Her full thanks go to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply business.

loans.name: Shakila's Group

texts.en:
Shakila is a 41-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and six children in Punjab, Pakistan. 

Her husband has a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife Shakila is a member of two-person lending group, and she has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store like sugar, rice, and biscuits to satisfy his clients more professionally, as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Shakila and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods like sugar, rice, and biscuits for her husband's general store

loans.name: Ajina

texts.en:
Ajina is a 22-year-old married woman who passed class IX standard (grade 9). She is married to Nur Mohammad. He has passed VIII standard (grade 8). They live in Malaigram in Dhupguri with their only son in a kaccha (made of straw and mud) house of their own.  Ajina is engaged in sewing and her husband is a businessman.
 
Ajina stitches many varieties of dresses and sells them in the local market shops. According to her, though this is a profitable business, her earnings are not sufficient for her family’s needs. Her husband’s business is not running smoothly either. She is unable to meet her household expenses as the prices of essential commodities are increasing gradually now. 

She learned that BJS (Kiva’s partner) offers loan to women in the community, so she applied for a loan to buy another sewing machine to generate more income. With the new machine, she can stitch more clothes in less time and sell them in the shops. Her main interest is to continue fighting for her family’s well being and she wants to work to make her dreams come true.
 
In the future, she wants to open a tailoring shop in the market with the profit from her business where she can employ more women from her village.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for preparing many kinds of clothes, dresses etc.

loans.name: Tofig

texts.en:
Tofiq is a taxi driver. He is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents and sisters in hostel for refugees in the Abseron region. 

Tofig’s family has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Zangilan city for 21 years. His mother is a housewife, and his father is a pensioner.

Today Tofig wants to repair his car’s engine. For this reason, he has applied to Komak company for a loan of 1,000 (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

He is thankful to Kiva and the lenders for help. 

In the future he wants to increase his business and monthly income. Then he wants to get married and have lovely children.

loans.use: to repair his car’s engine

loans.name: 01.05.14 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Vân is applying for a loan to purchase vegetables to resell. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables.

Vân is 41 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 01.05.14 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents

This is Vân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Vân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Vân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: 05.01.06 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hòa has a retail business selling dry food and vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables and dry food to resell.

Hòa is 57 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 05.01.06 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. Hòa lives with no other dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Hòa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hòa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, and the main hardship that Hòa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Hòa hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and dry food to resell

loans.name: 07.03.07 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods to sell.

Hương is 29 years old and she is married with 1 child. She is the group leader of the 07.03.07 Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for 3 years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods to sell

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: El señor Víctor tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, alcanzo a estudiar el bachillerato en humanidades y no cuenta con dependientes económicos a cargo. Actualmente vive en el domicilio de su tía en calidad de cuidador, además presta servicios en una empresa de importaciones percibiendo de esta manera un salario mensual fijo.  La casa en la que se encuentra no está en  buenas condiciones por ello solicita un crédito para la refacción de su vivienda. asi podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Víctor, 27, is single and has no dependents in his care.  He studied humanities in college.

Currently Víctor lives in his aunt's house as a caretaker.  He also earns a steady monthly salary working for an import business.

The house where he lives isn't in good condition so he's requesting a loan to make repairs and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs on his house

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 44 years of age, is a single mother and has one child. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 17 years, and has a net income of PHP 6,000 a day. Her profits earned were usually spent on electric bills and school allowances of her child, and she also purchased a lot. 

Due to insufficient capital, Elizabeth would like to request a loan from those generous lenders for PHP 50,000 to purchase chips, beverages, breads, biscuits, powdered juice, shampoo, conditioners, and food seasonings to sell. 

She's hoping her business will continue to grow so that she can save more for their future.

loans.use: To purchase chips, beverages, breads, biscuits, powdered juice, shampoo, conditioners, and food seasonings to sell.

location.town: #17 Pilar St. District 3, Cauayan City, Isabela

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, age 43, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of six children. He is an honest and hardworking man who desires to educate all his children to a secondary level.

He deals in produce buying and selling maize, rice, and groundnuts; he gets an additional income from farming.  Seasonality changes affect his business as it reduces crop production.

John is requesting a loan to buy more produce to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has always been an entrepreneur.  From opening a day care to a kids’ jumper rental company, he’s always found a way to use his entrepreneurial spirit to bring a smile to kids’ faces. That’s why, when inspiration hit to open a soft-serve ice cream truck, he knew he had to do it. 

He opened NEU Flavor Ice Cream modeled after the Mr. Frosty soft serve trucks that many kids grew up with on the East Coast.  Expanding his menu to include treats such as banana splits, floats and Hawaiian shaved ice, James has a menu that would satisfy any sweet tooth.  For James, it’s not just about seeing the kids smile, but helping recapture the childhood memories of all the adults who frequent his truck. “There’s no one that doesn’t like an ice cream truck,” said James.

There are currently two trucks in James’ fleet, and he does both catering and traditional ice cream truck rounds in neighborhoods, where kids eagerly wait for the all too familiar jingle.  He wants to expand his business to do more corporate catering and is using his $5,000 Kiva loan to purchase a pushcart where he can serve personalized frozen treats at corporate office parties and socials.

There are not many soft serve trucks in the San Diego market and in the future, he wants to expand to several trucks and have multiple employees.  His ultimate business dream is nothing flashy; he just wants to provide a stable future for his wife of 11 years, their two kids, and the kids that they foster.

“I’m just a humble guy who values hard work and I appreciate people who appreciate my business,” said James. “It’s why I love what I do.”

Check out NEU Flavor’s website: www.neuflavoricecream.com

loans.use: to purchase a pushcart to serve personalized frozen treats

loans.name: Raff Yuro

texts.en: Raff Yuro is married with two children. He manages a transportation business in their village to make a living. He earns well enough in this business to provide for his family. He took a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to cover the costs of motorcycle maintenance. He wants to expand his transportation business to have a better source of income for his family in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: 07.01.34 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

Hoa is 40 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 07.01.34 Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent (another child is grown up).

This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoa has been involved in this business for 3 years. The main hardship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita is married with two children, and she helps her husband in their fishing business to make a living. She sells fish in the market, while her husband fishes. She earns well for the family. She took a new loan from GDMPC to buy a foam chest, which is used to keep more fish. Emelita wants to expand her business and to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy a foam chest used to keep more fish

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el caserío de El Lirio una zona rural del distrito de Colasay una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, en la Región Cajamarca sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de cafeto, con una experiencia en el rubro de 14 años, son una familia emprendedora, Antonio ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 700 nuevos soles para utilizarlo en labores culturales, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha.

Ayudando de esta manera a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.
texts.en:
Antonio is 58 years old and lives together with his wife in the village of El Lirio in a rural zone of the Colasay district. The area is characterized by its verdant landscapes and a community that is engaged in agricultural, commercial and livestock farming activities. It is located two hours from the city of Jaén in Cajamarca, a region in the northern highlands of Peru.

Antonio works in agriculture, specifically cultivating coffee bushes. He has 14 years of experience in this field and is part of an enterprising family. Antonio has requested a loan of 1,700 nuevos soles for use in horticultural work, the application and incorporation of pest-control substances, fertilizers, and labor for the harvest.

He believes that these actions will result in physiological, morphological and productivity improvements in his cultivation, as well as ensure a timely harvest. With greater production and better product quality, he will have no problems selling his product.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and materials for the application of pest-control substances

loans.name: Jesie Rose

texts.en:
Jesie Rose earns an income through her transportation business, while her husband works as a seaman to make a living. 

She has been providing motor transportation services and rental for five years, and she earns well from it. She took a new loan from GDMPC to buy another motorcycle. She wants to save a portion of her returns to be used for their future living.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo tiene 26 años de edad vive junto a su esposa en el Caserío El Lirio una zona rural del distrito de Colasay, una comunidad caracterizada por sus paisajes verdes, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, ubicada en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años cultivando cafeto, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos y pago de mano de obra de la cosecha de su cultivo y de esta manera proteger a sus cultivos de cualquier plaga, obteniendo una cosecha oportuna, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Arturo, 26, lives with his wife in the El Lirio settlement in the rural area of Colasay.  This is a community known for its green countrysides, where the residents have developed businesses in agriculture and animal husbandry.  It is located 2 hours from the city of Jaen, in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

Arturo has been working in agriculture for 10 years, cultivating coffee.  He is requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy fertilizers to maintain his crops and to pay for labor to harvest his crops.  This way he can protect his crops from any pests, obtain a plentiful harvest, and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor to harvest his coffee crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and goats for his business.

loans.name: Roxana Maribel

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 41años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el Caserío de Ochenta y Uno, una zona rural del Distrito de San Felipe, una comunidad ubicada en la, carretera Olmos- Corral quemado lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante el comercio de alimentos preparados y agricultura pertenecientes a la Provincia de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una bodega donde ofrece venta de abarrotes, arroz, menestras, aceite, azúcar, leche entre otros, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Roxana is 41 years old.  She lives with her husband in the village of “Ochenta y Uno”, a rural area in the San Felipe district, which belongs to Jaén province in Peru’s northern highlands.  The community is located along the Olmos Corral - Quemado highway, which has permitted development through trade of prepared foods and farming.  Roxana has a store where she sells groceries, rice, soup, oil, sugar, milk, and other products.  She is requesting a loan of 2, 000 nuevos soles to purchase groceries to stock her business and in this way, generate higher income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, rice, soup, milk, and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Elar

texts.es:
Elar tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el Caserío de Huacapampa, una zona rural de Cañarís, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de cafeto, con una experiencia en el rubro de 4 años, es un joven emprendedor ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos y una segunda parte para pagar la mano de obra de la cosecha de su cultivo y de esta manera tener una mejor producción de café y cosecha oportuna, generándole ingresos para apoyar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Elar, 23, lives with his parents in the rural Huacapampa settlement, in a rural part of Cañarís.  The residents here are engaged in farming, commerce and animal husbandry.  This area is located 2 hours from Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

Elar is a farmer who cultivates coffee.  He has 4 years of experience in this line of work.  He is a young entrepreneur who is requesting a loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles to buy fertilizers to maintain his crops, and also to pay for workers at harvest time.  In this way he will produce more coffee and have a good harvest, so that he can generate income to support his parents.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor to help harvest his coffee crops

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.ru:
Анварчон живет в одном из сел городка Дангары. Анварчон живет не один, а со своей дружной большой семьей состоящая их девяти человек, в том числе родители, жена и дети. Анварчон женат и воспитывает 6 летнего сына и 4ех летнею дочку. Его жена домохозяйка она следит за порядком дома и за детьми, пока Анварчон на работе.
   Анварчон занимается продажей фруктов и овощей на ранке. Так как у Анварчона большая семья и чтобы ее обеспечить ему проходится много работать. Он выходит на работу в любую погоду. Самому Анварчону его работа нравиться. Он хорошо проводить время, общаясь с новыми людьми помогая им сделать выбор и тем самым зарабатывать. 
  Анварчон хочет на продажу привести больше продуктов и увеличить количество, качество и различность товара. Он знает, что таким образом он увеличит доходность от его деятельности. Но чтобы реализовать задуманное Анварчон финансово не может, поэтому он просит ему помочь. Он ждет вашей помощи.
texts.en:
Anvarjon lives in one of the villages near the town of Dangara. He does not live alone, but with his close-knit extended family, consisting of nine people and including his parents, wife, and children. Anvarjon is married and has a six year old son and a four year old daughter. His wife is a homemaker and takes care of the house and the children while Anvarjon is at work.

Anvarjon sells fruits and vegetables at the market. Because he has a large family, he has to work hard to take care of them. He goes to work in any weather. He likes his work and has a good time, talking to new people and helping them to make choices, and thus earning money.

Anvarjon wants to have more groceries for sale and to improve the number, quality, and selection of his goods. He knows that this will make his business more profitable. But Anvarjon does not have the money to implement his plan, and this is why he is asking for help. He is waiting for your help.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products in order to increase the number, quality, and selection of goods for sale

loans.name: Ranilo

texts.en:
Ranilo is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Ranilo grows rice on his farm. Ranilo is asking for a loan  to buy fertilizer and pesticides as well as to pay for the labor costs of the farm. 

With this loan, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm thus augmenting his harvest and yield. Ranilo hopes to expand his farm so that it will generate more revenue. This revenue will assist with the needs of his family, especially the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides as well as to pay for the labor costs of the farm

loans.name: Xiomara Yamileth

texts.es:
Xiomara de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, dejó la escuela debido a que sus padres se separaron, solo quedó con su mamá y por lo económico ya no siguió estudiando, está casada, tiene 2 hijos que están en la escuela y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y albañilería y nadie mas vive con ella. 

Xiomara se dedica a la costura desde hace 15 años, pues al dejar de estudiar su mamá con esfuerzo la mandó a un curso de corte y confección y fue así que aprendió el trabajo, además se dedica con su esposo a la agricultura donde siembran pipián y maíz. Para llegar al lugar de trabajo, ellos tienen que caminar 25 minutos por eso se levantan a las 4:30 AM para prepararse e irse al trabajo, donde laboran 6 horas y regresan para atender su hogar y su taller de sastrería.


El préstamo será invertido en la siembra de 7,500 metros cuadrados de pipian, donde comprará 2 sacos de abono, 2 litros de herbicidas, 6 litros de foliar, para aradura y pago de mozo.


Su sueño es que sus hijos se gradúen en una carrera universitaria, ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de hacerlo, además sueña con poner su propio taller de costura con el que pueda hacer trajes y salir a venderlos al mercado, tener una casa de ladrillo pues la actual es de adobe y con la ganancia espera pagar el crédito y así tener las puertas abiertas de la institución.
texts.en:
Xiomara, who is 34 years old, went to school up to the ninth grade. She dropped out because her parents separated. She lived only with her mother and for financial reasons she didn't stay in school. She is married and has two children. The kids go to school and her husband works farming and in construction. No one else lives with her.

Xiomara has been working as a seamstress for fifteen years, since her mother struggled to send her to a dressmaking course when she dropped out of school. That is how she learned the trade. She also works farming alongside her husband. They grow corn and squash. In order to get to their workplace, they must walk 25 minutes, which is why they get up at 4:30 am to get ready and head to work. They work for six hours and then return to tend to their home and the sewing shop.

The loan will be invested in planting nearly two acres of squash. She will buy two sacks of fertilizer, two liters of herbicide, six liters of foliar pesticide, and pay for plowing and labor.

Her dream is for her children to graduate from college, because she didn't have that opportunity. She also dreams about setting up her own sewing shop, where she could make outfits and go out to sell them in the market. She would also like to have a brick home, since her current home is adobe. She expects to use her profits to pay off the loan so that the doors of the organization are open to her.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and weed killers, pay for labor, and plant nearly two acres of squash.

loans.name: Saphorn

texts.en:
Saphorn is 47 years old and married. He has three children, one of whom is a teacher in a public school and the other two are still students. Saphorn, aside from his farming work, acts as a public school teacher, teaching students between 10 – 15 years old. From his career as a teacher, he is able to generate a decent income for the support of his daily living costs. He has been a teacher for more than 15 years and a farmer for years.

Saphorn is taking this loan from HKL as his first cycle loan, which will be used to pay the educational fees for his son, who is enrolling as a year-one student in the faculty of mathematics. With this amount of funding, he hopes to provide his son with better opportunities through education, so he can become a professional and have a well-paid job in the future. Saphorn is very happy and thankful for the loan funded through Kiva to enable poor students to pursue a higher education, while contributing to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to pay the educational fees for his son.

loans.name: Maecel

texts.en: Maecel is studying Hotel, Restaurant, and Services at C-LAN Institute of Technology in order to have a better job in her future. Her parents were earning income from carpentry work while her mother takes care of her siblings. She is asking for this loan to cover the costs for her on-the-job training expenses as a requirement for her coming graduation. She is hopeful to have a better career someday to be able to help augment her family's living in the future.

loans.use: to cover the costs for her on-the-job training expenses

loans.name: Efipania

texts.en:
Efipania is a married woman and a mother of seven grownup children. She is engaged in the business of farming. Efipania has been in the farming business with her husband for more than 15 years now. This is their main source of income.

As of now, Efipania is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for the labor costs of the farm. Through this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for the labor costs of the farm

loans.name: Jeason

texts.en: Jeason is still going to pursue his dream of finishing his studies. He is continuing his studies in order to have a better future with his family. He took out his previous loan from Gata Daku MPC to cover the costs of school tuition and study materials for the first semester. Recently, Jeason requested a new loan to pay the school tuition fees for the second semester. He hopes that after this he will be able to work in a company related to his course of study.

loans.use: to cover the costs of school tuition and materials

loans.name: Elionora Gladys

texts.es:
La Señora Elianora es parte del grupo de crédito Zhullin desde hace 2 años, en todo este tiempo ha llegada a establecer una muy buena amistad con todas las socias del grupo, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que se encuentra rodeada de montañas por su geografía accidentada, se encuentra asentada inclinadamente y lo que más representa a la ciudad es su gente amable y trabajadora.
La Señora. Elianora tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 15 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en el colegio y su último hijo está en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión sastre y la casa  en donde viven es propia.
Doña Elianora se dedica a la atención de su negocio el cual es la un bazar y papelería, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 
Ella está repitiendo el crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de artículos de bazar y útiles escolares para seguir creciendo en su negocio. Su meta es salir adelante.
texts.en:
Elionora has been part of the loan group Zhullin for two years. During all this time, she has established a very good friendship with all of the group members. She lives outside of the city of Azogues, which is surrounded by mountains due to its rugged geography. The city is located on a slope and its friendly and hard-working people are what represent it best.

Elionora is 41 years old, married and as the fruit of her conjugal union she has conceived two sons who are 15 and 5 years old. Her elder son is studying in high school and her younger son is in primary school in the city. Her husband is a tailor and the house where they live is their own.

Elionora makes a living managing her business which is a dollar store and stationery shop. She works from Sunday to Sunday without a fixed timetable. She is requesting a successive loan, which she will invest in the purchase of merchandise for her dollar store and school supplies to continue growing her business. Her goal is to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy dollar store merchandise and school supplies

loans.name: Honey Grace

texts.en: Honey Grace studies Hotel and Restaurant and Services at the C-LAN  Institute of Technology in order to gain a better job in the future. Her parents were earning income from their fishing business. She joined GDMPC and has borrowed a new loan to pay school tuition fees for her second semester. Her education is her key to having work someday, which will improve her living situation. In the future, she wants to help her parents.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Brayan

texts.es: El señor Brayan tiene 18 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria y no cuenta con dependientes económicos a cargo. Presta servicios en una empresa de importaciones percibiendo un salario mensual fijo. Actualmente vive en el domicilio de sus padres pero el lugar en el que habita no se encuentra en buenas condiciones por ello solicita un crédito para refaccionar su vivienda, de esta manera logrará mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Brayan is 18 years old and is single.  He has an elementary school education and has no dependents.  He earns a fixed monthly salary working for an importing business.  He currently lives in his parent's home, but the place where he lives is not in good condition.  This is why he is requesting a loan to repair his home.  This way, he can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La señora Maria desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar, y generar sus propios ingresos, aprendiendo diferentes oficios, y trabajando en diferentes lugares, asi conoció a quien actualmente es su esposo, con quien se casó muy joven y ya tiene 2 hijos, a los cuales apoya en todo aspecto, trabaja arduamente para generar un ingreso que le permita mantenerlos, darles una buena educación y un hogar cómodo. Se dedica a la venta de mercadería, todos los días se dirige a buscar clientes, visitando a quienes deseen hacer algún pedido y clientes que tienen cuentas por pagar con ella. Su esposo también le ayuda con las ventas y en algunas ocasiones con las cobranzas. Entre ambos logran generar ingresos para su hogar. Actualmente necesita un crédito para comprar mercadería (perfumes y colonias) y abastecer su negocio para generar mayores ingresos y proporcionar a su famiia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Maria has had to work and generate her own income since she was very young. She has learned various trades and worked in different places, and that is how she met the man who is now her husband. She was married very young and already has two children, whom she supports in every way. She works hard to generate income which allows her to support them and to give them a good education and a comfortable home. She works selling merchandise, and every day she goes out in search of customers, visiting those who would like to place an order as well as customers who have accounts to be paid to her. Her husband also helps with the sales, and on some occasions with the collection of payments. Between the two of them, they successfully generate income for their household. Currently, she needs a loan to buy merchandise (perfumes and colognes) to stock her business, in order to generate more income and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (perfumes and colognes) to stock her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 53-year-old single woman with two children. She describes herself as innovative. 

Agnes operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell, and she has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. 

Agnes describes her biggest business challenge to be expensive fuel. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a gas cooker and energy saving Jikos (cooking stove) for use in her food stall. 

Agnes’ business goal is to have a modern café within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a gas cooker and energy saving Jikos

loans.name: Jose  Miguel

texts.es:
José  nació en la ciudad de Latacunga en la parroquia La Matriz  de la provincia de Cotopaxi perteneciente a la República del Ecuador, esta zona se caracteriza por sus habitantes que se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales menores y ganado de leche y de carne,  José tiene 18 años de edad, actualmente se encuentra soltero, vive solo con su madre en una casa otorgada por el gobierno  desde hace ya algunos  años.
Ha sido para él muy satisfactorio para él el poder ayudar a su madre en todos los gastos de la casa y ser un gran apoyo en las actividades del hogar como en el negocio, aprendió desde muy joven esta actividad y desde ahí se dedica a la producción de leche y crianza de animales, está actualmente estudiando para ser bachiller, pues a pesar de todas las necesidades ha salido adelante y ahora quiere tener sus propios ganados. Con el esfuerzo de sus padres pudo terminar la primaria, por la difícil situación económica  de su familia tuvo que trabajar desde muy pequeño y así poder ser un gran apoyo para él y su familia. Aprendió de esta actividad ya que es muy común en la zona, por ser un sector rural, trabaja de 6 a 8 horas diarias en el cuidado de los animales.
Se le hace un poco difícil el transportar su ganado para las diferentes ferias ya que no cuenta con un transporte propio para ello, pero pese a esto no se ha hecho mayor problema, al contrario le ha motivado para salir adelante por el bien de él y el de su familia.
 Por el momento solicita un crédito para poder adquirir una vaca lechera, la misma que servirá para obtener más rentabilidad utilidad con la venta de la leche. José  quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
José was born in the city of Latacunga in La Matriz parish in Cotopaxi province, which belongs to the Republic of Ecuador. This zone is characterized by inhabitants who engage in the raising and selling of small animals and cattle for milk and meat.

José is 18 years old, currently single, and lives alone with his mother in a house that was granted by the government a few years ago. It has been very satisfactory for him to be able to help his mother with all of the household expenses and to support the household activities and business. He learned this work from a very young age and from that point he has been involved in milk production and the raising of animals. 

He is currently studying to graduate school, because in spite of all of the necessities he has gotten ahead and now wants to have his own cattle. Through his parents' efforts he was able to finish his primary education. Because of the family's difficult economic situation, he had to work since he was very small and thus be a great help for himself and his family.

He learned this activity since it is very common in the rural sector where he lives. He works from 6 to 8 hours daily caring for the animals. It is a little difficult for him to transport the cattle to the different markets since he does not have his own transport. In spite of this, it has not been a significant problem. On the contrary, it has motivated him to get ahead for the good of himself and his family.

At the moment he requests a loan to acquire a dairy cow, which will allow him to earn more profits through the sale of milk. José would like to extend his sincere thanks and greetings to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making possible the growth in his professional and personal life.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and improve his income

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad donde su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, maíz, entre otros, ganadería y comercio, ubicado a una hora con cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados y junto a su esposo a la confección de estructuras metálicas a pedido, son una familia emprendedora, Mercedes ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 100 nuevos soles para la compra de utensilios para venta de comida, insumos para negocio y gastos familiares y de esta manera tener mayor oportunidad de atender la demanda de clientes comensales y ello generará mayor ingresos para una mejora en calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 50 years old and lives with her husband in Cayaltí district, a community whose population farms sugar cane, corn, etc., beef, and business. It is located one hour and forty minutes from Chiclayo city on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells prepared food and along with her husband makes metal items to order. They are a hard-working family. Mercedes seeks a loan of 3100 nuevos soles in order to buy utensils to sell food, ingredients for her business and family expenses, and in this way have greater opportunity to meet her customer's demands and generate greater income in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy utensils to sell food and ingredients for her metalsmithing business.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el caserío de El Lirio una zona rural del distrito de Colasay, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, ubicado en la Región, Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cafeto, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para utilizarlo en labores culturales, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y pago de mano de obra para su cosecha y de esta manera mejorar la productividad de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto para ofrecerlo a un buen precio, generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer is 26 years old and lives with his wife in El Lirio village in a rural area of Colasay district. It is a community characterized by green forests, whose population is dedicated to farming, business and livestock. It is located two hours from Jaén city in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He has a business growing coffee, with experience of around 10 years. He seeks a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to use for labor, the application and incorporation of pesticides, fertilizers, and paying labor for harvesting and in this way improve the productivity of his crops. In this way he will also have an optimal harvest with increased production, a better quality products to offer at a good price, generating income for his family.

loans.use: to produce pesticides, buy fertilizers and pay for labor to harvest coffee.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.en:
Lazaro’s grocery store and deli may be new – he just took over the business this month – but Lazaro is certainly no stranger to owning his own establishment. Realizing that Somerville had few Hispanic stores in the community and being a true entrepreneur, Lazaro identified that there was a need to be met. He founded his own smaller store four years ago, and it has done well thus far.

Originally from Mexico, Lazaro moved to New York 16 years ago. He may not possess a college degree, but he has business savvy. His new storefront in Somerville specializes in selling Hispanic and Mexican foods and other products.

The funds from this loan will go towards renovating Lazaro's store, including the purchase of new counters and tables, as well as making various repairs. Looking forward, Lazaro enjoys cooking and has obtained a permit to sell food in a restaurant setting. However, he has not determined a prime location yet. Eventually, he would like to expand into that area of the business.

loans.use: To purchase new counters and tables for his Hispanic grocery and deli

loans.name: Marguba

texts.ru: Маргуба трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она вместе со своей семьей живет в сельской местности. Маргуба 4 месяцев назад начала свой бизнес скотоводством. Маргуба откармливает крупно - рогатого скота. Она откармливает скот дома. Маргуба хочет развевать свой новый бизнес. Ее муж помогает ей и всегда поддерживает. Маргуба запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Marguba is a hard-working woman. She is married, with three children, and lives with her family in the countryside. Four months ago Marguba started a  business raising cattle and feeding them at home. She wants to expand her new business. Her husband helps her and always supports her. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 somoni (TJS) to buy cattle and increase her working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle and increase the working capital of her new business

loans.name: Jenevieve

texts.en: Jenevieve is studying Healthcare (Nursing Aide) at C-lan Institute of Technology. She used her previous loan to pay her school tuition fees and for this second semester, she needs financial assistance for her allowances and other miscellaneous expenses.  Her future plans are to find a job related to her course and become successful with her own family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of her allowances this semester

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria, 64, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Pedro and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gloria operates a pineapple growing farm. She grows pineapple on their farm located in Cavite. It is in the highlands where it is suited to growing pineapple. She sells her product to markets and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm.

Gloria hopes that her business will stay and dreams of having good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Luz Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora. Luz se encuentra realizando su séptimo crédito a lado de sus compañera del grupo de crédito Zhullin, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que se encuentra rodeada de montañas por su geografía accidentada, se encuentra asentada inclinadamente y lo que más representa a la ciudad es su gente amable y trabajadora.
Doña Luz tiene 31 años de edad, está casada  y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 12, 9, 5 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y dos de sus hijos en una escuelita, su esposo labora en una panadería de su propiedad, la casa en la que vive es arrendada.
La Señora Luz se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos  pero para aportar a la economía de su casa se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cuyes, también se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha  vende en su ciudad. 
Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luz is getting her seventh loan alongside her companions in the loan group Zhullin. She lives outside the city of Azogues, which is surrounded by mountains due to its rugged geography. The city is situated on a slope and its friendly and hard-working people are what represent it best.

Luz is 31 years old and married. Through her conjugal union she has conceived four children who are 12, 9, 5 and 2 years old. Her eldest son studies in high school and two her younger children are in primary school. Her husband works in a bakery on their property. The house where they live is rented. 

Luz takes care of her children and supports the household expenses by raising hens and guinea pigs. In addition she does some agricultural work and sells her harvest in the city. She will invest her loan in the purchase of chickens. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Dilshoda

texts.ru: Дилшода молодая и мотивированная женщина. Она родилась в 1993 году. Дилшода замужем, но не имеет детей. Она 5 месяцев назад начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она арендует помещение в ателье. Дилшода привлекает клиентов благодаря хорошему сервису. Дилшода хочет купить машинку для вышивания. Таким образом, она хочет привлечь больше клиентов. Дилшода запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки вышивальной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilshoda is a motivated young woman who was born in 1993.  She is married but does not have any children yet.  Five months ago, she launched her own business and started sewing women's clothes.  She rents some space in a sewing shop, and attracts her customers with the quality of her services.  She now wants to buy an embroidery machine, in order to attract an even larger number of customers.  She is taking a loan of 4,000 somoni for the purchase of an embroidery machine.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine for her new business.

loans.name: Eva Germania

texts.es:
La Señora. Eva esta realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Zhullin, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que se encuentra rodeada de montañas por su geografía accidentada,  se encuentra asentada inclinadamente y lo que más representa a la ciudad es su gente amable y trabajadora.
La Señora. Eva tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 8 y 4 años que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo se dedica a la construcción, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Eva se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cuyes,  cultiva sus terrenos y lo que cosecha lo  vende en su ciudad, también tres veces a la semana  limpia casas. 
Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, pollos y en alimento para animales. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Eva is getting her second loan alongside her friends and companions in the loan group Zhullin. She lives outside the city of Azogues, which is surrounded by mountains due to its rugged geography. The city is situated on a slope and its friendly and hard-working people are what represent it best.

Eva is 30 years old, married and has two children who are 8 and 4 years old. Her children study in primary school in the city. Her husband works in construction and they live in their own house.

Eva makes a living raising chickens and guinea pigs. She cultivates some lands and sells her harvest in the city. She also cleans houses three times a week. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of guinea pigs, chickens and animal feed. Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijas en el Caserío de Miraflores una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad que se caracteriza por un relieve accidentado lo que le ha permitido tener diversos pisos ecológicos para la agricultura, su población se dedica a la ganadería comercio y agricultura, ubicado a cinco horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando cafeto de la variedad catimor tiene sembrando 2 has de su propiedad, esta actividad lo realiza desde hace 20 años, junto a su esposa también se dedican a la cría y venta de animales menores patos, gallinas, pavos, cerdos, ofreciéndolos en el mercado de la zona.

Diego ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo, con la compra de abono y con ello obtendrá buena producción y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Diego is 49 years old, lives with his wife and daughters in Caserío de Miraflores, a rural area in Santo Tomás district. The community is characterized by an uneven topography which has permitted it to have diverse ecological levels for agriculture. Its population concentrates on raising cattle and farming. it is located five hours from Cutervo city, which is located in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountainous region of Peru.

Diego farms, growing the catimor variety of coffee. He has been growing coffee for 20 years. Along with his wife he also raises and sells small animals such as ducks, chickens, turkeys, pigs, offering them in the zone's market.

Diego seeks a loan for 1000 nuevos soles to provide maintenance to his crops, buying fertilizer and thus he will have a good production and greater income in order to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Sarita Beatriz

texts.es:
Sarita Beatriz tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotun, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, pavos, gallinas, cerdos y pollos, Sarita se dedica a esta labor desde que se caso, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, es una madre emprendedora ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores cerdos y pavos por temporada navideña y alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos, para posteriormente ofrecerlos a un buen precio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Sarita Beatriz is 34 years old and lives with her family in the district of Oyotun, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru. The community relies on farming, livestock, and trade for income. 

Sarita Beatriz earns a living by raising and selling small animals such as ducks, turkeys, chickens, and pigs. She has been doing this since getting married, in order to help her husband with the household expenses. 

She is an enterprising mother, and has requested a loan of 2000 Nuevos Soles to buy pigs and turkeys for the Christmas season, as well as feed to fatten these animals. She will then selling them at a good price and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy pigs and turkeys, as well as animal feed.

loans.name: Odar

texts.es:
Odar tiene 21 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y su dos menores hijos en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en el mercado de su distrito, son una familia emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra de abarrotes panetones, vinos, leche, chocolate para abastecer su negocio por temporada navideña y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes diversas opciones, generando al mismo tiempo mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Odar is 21 years old and lives with his spouse and two young children in the district of Pucará. The people in the community earn a living through farming, livestock farming, and trade. The community has a hot climate and is located two hours from the city of Jaén, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru.

Odar earns a living by selling convenience store items in the market in the district. His family is an entrepreneurial one. He has requested a loan of 1200 Nuevos Soles in order to buy groceries, Christmas cakes, wine, milk, and chocolate to stock up his business for the Christmas season. This will allow him to provide his customers with many choices and generate more income for his family at the same time.

loans.use: to buy goods for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is a married woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a food vending business for more than 20 years now, selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her area. She cooks and sells rice cakes or 'puto'. This is the source of her income.

Zosima is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, yeast, and others. With this, she will be able to cook more and sell more snack foods to the people in her area. In the future, Zosima hopes to make her business a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, yeast, and others

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru: Мухиддину 24 года. Он уроженец города Дангары. Мухиддин женатый человек. Его жена домохозяйка. Мухиддин с женой живет в родительском доме вместе со всей семьей.
