Samra is a 22-year-old woman who is living in Lahore, Pakistan. The financial condition of her family is not good; her husband is a tailor by profession and his work mostly consists of festivals. 

Her husband conducted a tailoring business in which he provides the service of sewing clothes to his customers. He is very expert in his profession and people like his stitched clothes a lot. He has to pay the rent on a shop on a monthly basis, so this is the reason he decided to buy a shop of his own. However due to a lack of availability of funds, Samra requested a loan for her husband so he can buy a tiny shop to continue his business.

Samra is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a shop for tailoring business

loans.name: Musingi Bora Group

texts.fr: La cliente M’Mugorozi est une commerçante et membre de l’association d’affaires « Musingi Bora », senior  entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 54 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui, 2 étudient encore. La cliente est une vendeuse de viande. Elle installe ses marchandises dans une maison (Boucherie) sur les artères animées de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Son conjoint est un Ingénieur. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 22 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 50 kg de viande. Ainsi, elle souhaite devenir grossiste, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile poste conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: M’Mugorozi, the customer, is a retailer and a member of the Musingi Bora business group. She is an experienced and dynamic entrepreneur who is 54 years old and the mother of 6 children, 2 of whom are still at school. M’Mugorozi sells meat. She displays her merchandise in a butcher shop located one of the town's busy main roads. She started her business with her husband's help. Her spouse is an engineer. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the MFI Hekima. She has been in this line of work for 22 years. This new loan will be used to buy 50 kilos of meat. She wants to become a wholesaler, to build a house and to feed her children and ensure that they get an education. Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for its help in making non-bankable female entrepreneurs self-sufficient, especially during this difficult time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 50 kilos of meat.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is an experienced farmer from Chiva village in the Vayots Dzor region. He lives with his wife, son, and school-age daughter. Armen's wife works in the village school. Unfortunately, her salary is so low it is impossible to meet the very basic needs of the family. 

To take care of the family's needs Armen is extensively engaged in agribusiness; he breeds cattle, sheep, and hens, and cultivates peaches, apricots, apples, pears, and walnuts. With the help of his son he sells the products in the local market, which is an important source of income. Breeding sheep is the most essential component of Armen's business; he currently wants to expand it a little bit. 

To reach that goal, he needs a loan of $3,000 to purchase 30 sheep. As this is Armen’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Armen and his family will be very thankful to the lenders for their good will and support.

loans.use: to purchase 30 sheep.

loans.name: Ararati Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sawasawa est une commerçante, présidente et membre d’un collectif d’affaires « Ararati »,   entrepreneur, âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants qui tous, étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des divers matériels domestiques usagers. Elle étale sa marchandise sur la route principale de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu comme prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Son conjoint est un pasteur dans une Eglise locale. Il y a 2 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 résistances de chauffage, 2 casseroles, 5 gobelets  métalliques. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique poste conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Sawasawa, the customer, is a retailer and the leader of the Ararati business group. She is a 35-year-old entrepreneur who is married and the mother of 5 children who are all studying. Sawasawa sells various household items. She displays her merchandise along the side of the main road in town. She started her business with funds she received from Hekima in the form of a loan. She has been in this line of work for 2 years. Her spouse is the pastor of a local church. This new loan will be used to buy 2 heaters, 2 pans and 5 metal cups. She hopes to increase her business, clothe and feed her children and ensure that they get an education. She strongly thanks Hekima for its help in making non-bankable female entrepreneurs self-sufficient, especially in this critical time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 2 heaters, 2 pans and 5 metal cups.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
"My name is Shadrack. I work in the Finance Department for Juhudi Kilimo, an agricultural micro finance institute in Kenya. Previously, I  worked for Turame Community Finance, in Burundi as the Finance and Administrative Director. I have been in the micro finance industry for over 12 years and I like the industry because this is where poverty, food security and health issues are well addressed. 
I am the first born in a family of nine, married and I have three children who are in school. When I finished high school, I started my career in accounting and managed to educate my siblings from the salary. I did so because my mother had minimum resources to educate them. After they all finished high school training, I decided to go back to school to pursue a degree in finance and later pursued my MBA, both of which I financed through bank loans.
I am motivated to do a study related to the factors hindering financing for rural, small-scale farmers. I believe that this study will highlight the gaps in agricultural financing and will give practical recommendations on how financial institutions could provide appropriate financial and nonfinancial services to rural farmers in Kenya. I hope to bring the study results back to Juhudi and align it with the business growth strategy for the next four to five years. I also hope to be able to share the findings of my research with other Kiva partners in order to improve the financial product design at other MFIs to benefit loan recipients in the region. "

loans.use: To pay for a PhD in business administration and management with a concentration in entrepreneurship at the Kenya Methodist University.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is a freshman in the Software Engineering Program. This is his story:

I have chosen to become a programmer. Ever since I was a child, I have taken a deep interest in computers and electronics. I not only like to play computer games, I am also very curious about the process of game and program development. This was one of the reasons my parents sent me to the physics and mathematics lyceum #61, where I studied from the 1st grade. While studying at school, I attended a programming course at Tomsk State University of Control Systems and Radio Electronics. I also studied the basics of such programming languages as Visual Basic, С++, Turbo Pascal and Delphi. For further motivation, I participated in a number of competitions (Olympiads) in mathematics and informatics: the Lomonosov Olympiad, as well as School and City Olympiads on informatics. In 2013, I took third place in the AUCA informatics competition, which gave me a partial scholarship.

Aside from programming, I like to read sci-fi books, play chess, and devote my free time to physical activities, such as practicing aikido, wushu, and football. When it came to choosing a university, I knew that the AUCA was exactly what I needed. Not only because it is the best and most prestigious university in Kyrgyzstan, but also because it provides opportunities for all-around development of an individual and improvement of leadership skills through a number of intellectual contests and cultural events. This allows young people to become more communicative and self-confident, which is very important for better social integration and competitiveness on the labor market.

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Bennette

texts.en:
Bennette is a 26-year-old married woman with 5 children. 

She has a small plantation and grows tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbages, eggplant, etc., to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Bennette has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a shovel, bush-knives, a backpack sprayer and a wheelbarrow. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Bennette hopes to assist her family and help her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a shovel, bush-knives, a backpack sprayer and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Tenny

texts.en:
Tenny is a 20-year-old single woman with no children. She runs a small business selling pork buns in her community and has been doing this for 5 years. 

Tenny has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, yeast, baking powder, cooking oil, frying pan and a gas oven. She joined SPBD in December 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tenny will save more to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, yeast, baking powder, cooking oil, frying pan and a gas oven

loans.name: Asociacion De Agua Oriental - Eden Group

texts.es: La asociación de agua oriental - edén, está ubicada en la localidad de Puntiti del municipio de Sacaba, actualmente está conformada por 187 socios que cuentan con conexión al sistema de distribución de agua que fue financiado hace años por el gobierno y por aportes de cada uno de los vecinos para la perforación de un pozo y un tanque elevado para el almacenamiento. Actualmente el mismo está sufriendo sedimentación y el caudal se está secando, es por eso que en asamblea resuelven firmar un contrato de perforación de pozo con una empresa, tienen necesidad de 80 mil litros de agua día y construcción de tanque elevado para la recepción y distribución de la misma, para ello tienen parte de sus recursos en una cuenta de ahorro, pero para completar el monto necesitan un crédito. El vecindario ha crecido hasta más de 250 familias y actualmente por razones de abastecimiento no cubren esta diferencia.  Es un barrio que poco a poco y con aportes propios está encarando diferentes obras de mejoramiento para lograr una mejor calidad de vida para todas las familias que habitan la comunidad. La directiva actual está conformada por la señora Martha, Ada, Rosario y el señor Rober, que son los representantes para la gestión. El señor Rober no aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
The Asociación de Agua Oriental – Edén is located in Puntiti in the Sacaba municipality.  It is currently comprised of 187 members who have connection to the water distribution system.  This was financed years ago by the government and with contributions from each one of the neighbors.  This is for the drilling of a well and an elevated storage tank.

It is now suffering from sedimentation, and the flow is drying up.  That is why, in assembly, they resolve to sign a contract with a company to drill a well.  They need 80,000 liters of water a day, and they need to build an elevated tank to keep and distribute the water.  To do this, they have part of their resources in a savings account.  However, in order to complete the amount, they need a loan.

The neighborhood has grown to more than 250 families.  Currently, the are not covering the difference because of supply.  It is a neighborhood that, little by little, and with their own contributions, is addressing different works of improvement in order to achieve a better quality of life for all of the families that live in the community. 

The board of directors is comprised of Martha, Ada, Rosario, and Rober.  They are the representatives for the administration. Rober was not able to appear in the photo above.

loans.use: to drill a well for 250 families in the town of Puntiti

loans.name: Chat's Group

texts.en:
Chat, 54, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and he is married with five children, two of whom are still in school. 

The family’s main source of income is from planting chilies and beans. To add more income, he also sells Chinese noodle soup in his village while his wife is a paid worker. Having been in these businesses for 12 years, they can earn about 52,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Chat has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and completely paid back the loans which have helped him relieve the family's burden and improve their livelihood. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy chili and bean seeds to support his business. He hopes to grow more crops so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy chilies and bean seeds for supporting his business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Daygeline Mae is 20 years old and is the second of three children in the family. Her mother Evangeline supports the family through her general store and her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Daygeline Mae is studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration and is currently in the fourth year of this program.

Evangeline is borrowing Ph 8,816.4 to pay the tuition fees of the second semester of the 2013-14 school year.

When she graduates, Daygeline Mae plans to be gainfully employed to help her brother finish his schooling.

loans.use: to pay college tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Bintu  est une brave commerçante, dynamique, entrepreneur depuis 6 ans est membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Neema », âgée de 33 ans et mère de 4 enfants, qui tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse de braises. Elle étale ses activités au marché central de la place.  Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 25 sacs de braises. Elle bénéficia son premier capital par le truchement de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vetir et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle, pendant, ce moment poste conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Bintu is a brave and energetic merchant, and a member of Neema Group. She's been an entrepreneur for six years. She's 33 years old and the mother of four children, who all go to school.

She resells charcoal at the central market of the place where she lives. She's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, Hekima, in order to bolster her business. She will buy 25 sacks of charcoal. 

She obtained her first working capital thanks to her husband. In the future, she would like to increase her working capital, send her children to school, and provide them with clothes and food.

She thanks Hekima for its support of female entrepreneurs who are excluded from traditional banks, by granting them loans without tangible security, during this post-war time in the East of the country.

It has to be noted that some women are carrying their babies in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy 25 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
From a rural village in the Dambae district of Cambodia, Thea is 33-years-old and married with four children, who are still in school.  She and her husband are hard-working farmers who earn a living through rubber growing and cassava planting. The current business earns her about 100,000 KHR per day but she can manage to save about 40,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Thea is with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to plow the field. She hopes to make more crops to make a living better.

loans.use: to plow the field

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 35-year-old married woman.  She lives with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw in the city of Lahore for many years, but now his rickshaw’s body and engine are fully damaged. He has sold his rickshaw to a scrap dealer at a very low price. Now he wants to buy a new auto rickshaw but the funds are still short.  Her husband is unable to earn even a single penny for his family without a rickshaw.  Therefore, Yasmeen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.  Through the contribution of this loan amount her husband can easily buy a new rickshaw. 

Her husband and Yasmeen thank Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her husband pay cash to purchase a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Sophea is aged 32 and married. She lives in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal Steong province and she has two children. To make a living, she has been farming rice for six years earning about 28,000 KHR per day. 

Sophea is with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to build a proper latrine for her family to use. She hopes to have a clean latrine for her family to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine for her family to use

loans.name: Melea

texts.en:
Melea is 33 years old and married with 5 children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years.

She needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a garden hose and a rake. She became a member of SPBD in 2013. Melea will use the profits from her sales to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a garden hose and a rake.

loans.name: Purevkhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Purevkhuu, 26 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He has been transporting goods between districts since 2011. His wife stays at home, looking after their children. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy a trailer in order to double the quantity of goods that he can transport at a time. As a result, his income will increase twice, and his living standards will improve. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle trailer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, blocks, gravel, and to hire a worker.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y  vive en el municipio de  Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, como ropa como blusas, camisetas, pantalones, zapatos, para damas caballeros y niños. Este negocio lo tiene hace 5 años y realiza las ventas de manera ambulante y por pedidos. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para sostener el negocio, actualmente solicita otro de 5,000 Lempiras para surtir de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y zapatos para vender. Este de igual forma le ayudara, a obtener mayores ventas y mayores ganancias. Tiene como meta ser una gran empresaria y tener el negocio bien establecido para darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 33 years old and a single mother. She has three children, and lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, in the department of Santa Bárbara. She works selling general merchandise, such as clothing like blouses, T-shirts, pants and shoes for women, men and children. She has had this business for five years now, and makes her sales either from place to place or by order.

Mercedes has had a number of loans to support her business. She is requesting this loan of 5,000 HNL to buy clothing and shoes for women, men and children to sell. Like her previous loans, she hopes this loan will help her increase her sales and profits. Her goal is to be a great businessperson with a well-established business to give her family a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes for women, men and children to sell.

loans.name: Talagafa

texts.en: Talagafa is 23 years old and married with no children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 4 years. She has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil and a frying pan. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Talagafa will support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil and a frying pan.

loans.name: Hai's Group

texts.en:
A married mother living in a rural village located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Hai is 61 years old and has seven children. She is a rice farmer and she has been in this business for 43 years. The current business earns her about 27,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Hai’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for three cycles. The past loans have helped them improve their livelihoods. Hai is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for harvesting the rice field. She hopes to harvest more crops so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting the rice field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Naikim's Group

texts.en:
Naikim, 31, lives with her husband and three children in a village of Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for 13 years, and they supplement the family’s income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 23,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Naikim’s group consists of three members who live in the same village, and she has just started with VisionFund this loan cycle. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Naikim will use her portion to spend on water pumping and harvesting rice. She hopes to get more crop yield to increase her family’s income, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay for water pumping and harvesting rice

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: Rufina helps her husband to earn a living with her vending business, and she earns well from this. She successfully repaid her previous loans that she used in the business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase raw ingredients and snacks to vend. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and to be able to run her own store within a shelter.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and snacks to vend.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: En una localidad de bogotá, habita una niña de 15 años,  la cual a su edad tiene mucho sueños que le encantaría cumplir , el nombre de esa niña es Lina, se encuentra cursando grado 11 °  pero a la vez se encuentra estudiando lo que a ella más le gusta que es enfermería, gracias a un convenio con su colegio, ella se siente muy afortunada porque el precio es más bajo de lo normal y le posibilita que los padres se lo puedan pagar, después de un tiempo no le dan más ayuda con el convenio que tenia así que ella  quiere que la ayuden con el convenio de kiva,  ya que los hermanos estudian y los padres no pueden seguir pagando por los nuevos precios, pero se siente muy agradecida por todo lo que aprendió, ya que gracias a eso puede ayudar a el padre ya que el debe tener un control diario de atención porque se encuentra enfermo, ella podría ayudar con los conocimientos a los seres queridos y aquellas personas que pueda ayudar , en cuanto a las prácticas que fueron en un hospital en una unidad pediátrica, quedo muy contenta pues aprendió mucho y se pudo destacar en ello , Lina seguirá con los sueños que tiene para en un futuro verse como una gran medica las metas no se olvidaran sino más que nunca serán algo presente .
texts.en:
In an area of Bogota lives a 15-year-old girl who, even at her young age, has many dreams that she would like to make come true. This girl's name is Lina. She is currently in 11th grade and, at the same time, is studying nursing, which is her favorite.

Thanks to an agreement with her high school. she is fortunate that the cost is much lower than normal and gave her parents the ability to pay. After a certain amount of time, the agreement ran out and she was not given any more assistance, so she would like to have Kiva's assistance. Her siblings are also in school and her parents cannot continue to pay the higher costs. 

She is grateful for everything that she has learned, especially since she can help her father, who requires daily care because he is ill. She can use her knowledge to help her loved ones and others. She completed a clinical practice in the pediatric unit of a hospital and was very satisfied with this experience since she learned a lot and stood out in her program.

Lina will continue to pursue her dream of becoming a great doctor. She will not forget her goals since, more than ever, they are becoming a reality.

loans.use: to pay school fees for one semester.

loans.name: Chanleap's Group

texts.en:
As a married mother of one son, Chanleap is aged 18 living in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. To support her family, she and her husband farm rice as the main source of the family’s income and she can earn about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.  

Chanleap is in her first cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy a decent latrine. She hopes to have a clean latrine to use.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 45-year-old lady living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is a responsible mother; her younger son goes to a school for tuition in the morning and in the evening everyday. 

Her husband drives an auto rickshaw; he wants to grow his income so he can easily fulfill the basic needs of his family.  So he decided to buy an additional rickshaw to earn a daily fair. He has much savings but the amount is still short.  This is the reason Yasmeen requested a loan.  She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy a new auto rickshaw. 

She hopes that she would be able to earn enough savings until the time when her children get married. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her husband buy an additional rickshaw to offer for rent.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Brosat Sambo district of Kampong Thom province, Mom is a 47-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she has been farming and pig and cow-raising for almost 30 years. The current business earns her about US$18 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Mom has been with VisionFund for eight cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Now she is requesting a loan to pay her daughter’s tuition fees. She hopes to keep her daughter in school until her graduation.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fees.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally, 40, is married with four children, residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey of Battambang province. To support the family, she has been farming rice for twenty years while her husband works as a construction worker. Together, they can earn about KHR 33,000 per day and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs. 

Phally has been with VisionFund for seven cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Phally is now leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to pay for harvesting rice. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice

loans.name: Goretti

texts.en: Goretti is 49 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a business venture, doing landscaping. She has many years of experience in this line of business. Goretti needs a loan to buy plants, paint, marine plywood and a shovel. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy plants, paint, marine plywood and a shovel

loans.name: Penisila

texts.en:
Penisila is a 65-year-old widowed woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Penisila has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow and a spade.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Penisila hopes to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow and a spade

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is 19 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Christina has requested a loan to buy sugar, dripping oil, flour, yeast and a new frying pan. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Christina will help support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy sugar, dripping oil, flour, yeast and a new frying pan.

loans.name: Fredelito

texts.en: Fredelito is a young father with one child. He operates a farming business as a source of income. Fredelito aims to improve the growth of his rice crop production, but his capital is not sufficient. For this reason, he is asking for a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy seeds, insecticides and fertilizer. He hopes that his loan request will be approved to help him grow his business. In this way, he could give his child a better way of living and earn a better income someday.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides and fertilizer to use for his farming business

loans.name: Gasolo

texts.en: Gasolo is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan to buy fishing spears, fishing net, goggles, a life jacket and fishing gear. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Gasolo will invest in her children's education and her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing spears, fishing net, goggles, a life jacket and fishing gear.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as a customer-oriented person. He operates a retail store where he sells bags. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a strategic place, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to add stock of bags. His business goal is to be successful within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of bags

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert, age 31, is married with two school-age children. He is living with his wife and two children, ages 7 and 8. They live in the Tumauni province of Isabela. He operates and cultivates his rice and corn farmland. Aside from farming, he also raises cattle, hogs and chickens.

Albert is seeking additional capital of PHP15,000 to purchase farm supplies, such as fertilizer and insecticide for his farmland, and hog feed for his livestock business. His requested loan will really be of great help, most especially in increasing his income and improving his family’s quality of life. His dream is to keep going on with his agricultural business so he can sustain his family's needs and educate his two children someday.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for his farmland and hog feed for his livestock business.

loans.name: Alex Arturo

texts.es:
Alex Arturo tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Buenos Aires una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de frutas plátanos, mango, naranjas desde hace cinco años, con la ayuda de su esposa venden artículos para el hogar en una pequeña tienda ubicada en su domicilio, son una familia que se esfuerza por la labor que realizan.

Alex ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de plátano ya que es muy solicitado en esta temporada y una segunda parte para la compra de cubiertos, ollas, platos, tazas entre otros para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Alex Arturo is 46 years old and lives with his wife in the Buenos Aires district, in a community known for its algorrobo forest.  The inhabitants of the town, two hours away from the city of Piura on Peru's northern coast, work in farming, running businesses, and raising cattle.

Alex has been making a living selling fruits, such as a bananas, mangos and oranges for five years.  He receives help from his wife and they also sells household items from a small shop in their home.  The family works hard.

Alex has applied for a loan of 3000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy bananas, an item that is in high demand at this time of year.  He will also use the loan to buy cutlery and crockery, pots and pans, cups, and other items to sell to his customers.  With this Alex can earn a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy bananas and merchandise to stock up his business.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 59 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijas en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados desde hace cinco años en el mercado de la zona , es conocida por el buen sabor de sus platos que ofrece, adicionalmente vende pollo pelado su familia es unida y se esfuerza en la labor que realizan su esposo le apoya en esta labor, tienen clientela considerable.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para arreglos de su casa y de esta manera tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Agustina is 59 years old and lives with her husband and daughters in the Cayatlí district.  The inhabitants of the town, two hours away from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's northern coast, work in farming, running businesses, and raising cattle.

Agustina has been making a living selling food dishes in the local market for five years.  She is well-known for the tasty dishes she offers.  Agustina also sells skinned chicken.  Agustina's family is very close and everybody puts in a lot of effort in their work.  Agustina's husband supports her with this work.  The couple has a lot of customers.

Agustina is applying for a loan of 3000 Nuevo Soles in order to repair her house and, therefore, enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en El Caserío San Cristóbal, una zona rural del distrito de Cañaris, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de cafeto desde hace 15 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos y pago de mano de obra para su cosecha y de esta manera tener ingresos mayores para su familia.
texts.en:
Martin is 35 years old and lives with his wife and children in the San Cristóbal village, a rural area in the Cañaris district. The inhabitants of the area, two hours away from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's northern coast, work in farming, running businesses, and raising cattle.

Martin has been making a living growing coffee for 15 years and has applied for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy manure to support his crops.  He will also pay labourers to help with the harvest and will thus have a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and to pay for labourers to harvest his coffee crops.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 32 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has one child.
 
Marilyn is a stall owner and engaged in a business selling RTW (ready-to-wear clothing), kitchenwares and other dry goods. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this work. 

She has requested a loan to purchase additional RTW’s, kitchen utensils and other dry goods for resale. Marilyn has been a member of PMPC since November 2013. In the future, Marilyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional RTW’s, kitchen utensils and other dry goods.

loans.name: Muterian

texts.en:
Muterian is 65 years old, married, and the father of six children between the ages of three and twenty-five. For the last 15 years, he has farmed his own piece of land and earns a good income. Wheat has proven to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions.

He learned about VisionFund Kenya through a staff member. This will be his sixth loan. He plans to buy farm supplies and hire machinery for preparation of the land.  With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His future dreams are that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more wheat for commercial farming, buy his own farm machinery and educate his children. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Myshel

texts.en:
Myshel is 22 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Myshel is borrowing 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business.

Myshel has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Ntopio

texts.en:
Ntopio is 30 years old, married, and a father of four children aged two, four and seven years of age. Ntopio has been a livestock trader on the outskirts of Narok, Kenya for the last 13 years. He earns approximately KES. 25,000 each month.

Ntopio learned about VisionFund from a customer who was already receiving the services of the organization. Now requesting his third loan of KES. 60,000,  he intends to purchase more livestock for fattening and resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost business as well as to diversify into crop farming. Ntopio's dream is to be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattenning and resale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, a 51-year-old married mother of three from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. She has been in the farming business for the past three years. She earns a monthly income of 10,500 KES (Kenyan shillings) which she uses to support her family. 

This marks her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya after clearing her previous loans successfully. With the loan she has applied for, she will be able to purchase 10 bags of feed for her pigs. Additional income created will allow her to educate her children and buy food for the family. 

In the future, Susan would like to offer her children a quality education and improve the living standards of the family. She hopes to expand her pig farming.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, 35, is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Gina has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Gina requested a 26000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more charcoal to sell.

Gina has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda manages her own farm, planting and harvesting different types of crops and selling her products in the markets. She earns well to provide for the family. She successfully repaid her previous loan that she had used for her farm. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and pay maintenance costs for the farm. She hopes to have a better harvest and to improve the living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and pay maintenance costs for the farm.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Jhona is 20 years old and is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering. She is currently on the fourth year of this five-year course.

Jhona needs 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to pay for tuition fees of the second semester of the 2013-14 school year.

When she graduates, Jhona plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Rosa Lilian

texts.es: Doña Rosa Lilian agradece el apoyo brindado por los inversionistas en KIVA en alianza con la cooperativa COMIXMUL por apoyar a los pequeños y medianos agricultores, empresario y demás que sus sueños es ver crecer su negocio para fortalecimiento y desarrollo primeramente familiar y posteriormente como medio de generación de empleo para el país. Con su primer financiamiento ella pudo comprar los insumos que necesitaba para poder asistir sus cultivos de café los cuales tuvieron en esta temporada una buena cosecha logrando vender su producto de sus 2.5 manzanas de tierra cultivada y productora un 90%. Por lo que nuevamente ella ha decidido una vez más tocar las puertas de COMIXMUL donde ha solicitado un segundo financiamiento para poder cubrir los gastos de preparación de tierra y abonar nuevamente sus cultivos de café para poder por medio de las ganancias seguir ampliando sus cultivos como hasta ahora lo ha hecho. Ella espera ser apoyada una vez más para lograr cumplir sus metas esperanzas y sueños para con sus hijos y su vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Lilian is thankful for the support brought by the Kiva lenders in partnership with the COMIXMUL cooperative. This helps small and medium scale farmers, entrepreneurs and others who dream of seeing their business expand for the strengthening and development first within the family, and later on as a means of employment generation throughout the country.

With her first loan Rosa was able to buy the supplies that she needs to attend to her coffee crops. This season she has a good harvest and was able to sell the crops of her 4.35 acres of land resulting in about 90% productivity. She has decided again to knock on COMIXMUL's doors again to request a second financing in order to cover her expenses in preparing the land and fertilizing her coffee crops again. In this way she will be able to continue increasing the earnings on her crops, as she has done up till now. Rosa hopes to be supported once again to achieve her desired goals and dreams for her children and her life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to attend to her land and new coffee harvest.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a father of three living in Nairobi, Kenya's Mbotela estate. He was born in Limuru, Kenya, and currently runs a general shop at his residence in the capitol city. 

James first saw a Fresh Life toilet in the expansive Mukuru Kwa Njenga informal settlement, and was impressed by the great impact brought to the community by the toilet. 

James then developed a desire to be a part of the sanitation solution in the informal settlements. He therefore seeks a loan to purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet in Mukuru Kwa Njenga. He intends to use this franchise to create jobs for youth and help the community realize the benefits of proper sanitation. James hopes to eventually expand with more franchises in the area to make a bigger impact in the sanitation sector.

loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita operates and manages a construction and renovating business and also does farming to make a living. She earns well from this and was able to repay her previous loan successfully. She took a new loan from GDMPC Micro Finance to purchase fertilizer to improve the farm. Lolita hopes to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a single woman with one child who goes to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Doris operates a vegetable-stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Maggie

texts.en: Maggie appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a single woman with two school-going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Martha has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini-greengrocery in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Noem's Group

texts.en:
Noem, 35, is married with five children, residing in a rural village located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. For the last several years, she has been farming rice as a primary source of the family’s income and sometimes her husband works for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Noem has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her improve her standard of living. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Noem will use her portion to plow the fields. She hopes to increase her crop production.

loans.use: to plow the fields

loans.name: Evelin Johanna

texts.es:
Evelin Johanna es estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamos para poder terminar sus estudios, esta es su historia:Mi nombre es Evelin Johanna, tengo 23 años de edad, soy casada y vivo solo con mi esposo en San Pedro de Macorís. Vengo de una familia muy humilde, somos 5 hermanos y mi familia a tratado de sacarnos adelante con mucho trabajo. Mi esposo no pudo terminar sus estudios por ello tuvo que empezar a trabajar y con sus ingresos no nos alcanza para costear la carrera.
Decidí estudiar medicina en la Universidad Central del Este porque siempre me ha fascinado esa carrera y es mi sueño. Me gustaría ayudar a los necesitados y aportar un granito de arena a la sociedad. Mi familia tiene gran esperanza en mi porque han visto el deseo de superación que tengo, que ha pesar de las dificultades que se me han presentado he seguido adelante.
La razón principal por la cual solicito el préstamo es porque ya tengo 8 cuatrimestres, es decir, la mitad de la carrera cursada y de no tener una ayuda tendré que dejar los estudios.
Mi meta es estudiar y llegar a ser una gran profesional, quiero poder ser una persona de bien y una gran doctora. Para mi es muy importante terminar mis estudios porque seria un gran logro en mi vida y poder ejercer la carrera que realmente me gusta.
texts.en:
Evelin Johanna is in medical school. She requests a loan so that she will be able to finish her education. This is her story:

My name is Evelin Johanna. I am 23 years old, married, and I live with my husband in San Pedro de Macorí. I come from a very humble family with 5 children, and my family worked very hard to move us forward. My husband was not able to finish his education because he had to begin to work and, with his income, we could not afford for him to finance his education.

I decided to study medicine in the Universidad Central del Este because it has always interested me and it is my dream. I would like to help the needy and make my contribution to society. My family has high hopes for me because they have seen my desire to overcome and, despite great difficulties, I have continued forward.

The main reason why I am requesting this loan is because I have completed 8 quarters, or half of the course of study, and if I do not receive help, I will have to drop out of school. My goal is to study and become a great professional. I want to be a good person and a great doctor. It is important to me to finish my studies because it will be a great achievement and I will be able to have a career that I love.

loans.use: to pay for education expenses.

loans.name: Allah Ditta

texts.en:
Allah Ditta is a 33-year-old married man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of three children. All of them go to school, and one son helps him after attending school. 

Allah Ditta has owned a dairy farm in his town since 2003. He produces milk from buffaloes two times a day and sells it to the retailers, which is a very tough job for a single person. He has been purchasing fodder in bulk and has been feeding his cattle for months. He has to buy fodder in bulk and build up his cowshed as well. However, due to lack of funds, he is unable to buy fodder and materials for the construction of the cowshed.

He requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so he can overcome these deficiencies and carry on his dairy farm smoothly. 

From the profit amount, he would like to start his own livestock breeding business also, as he has now acquired sufficient experience in this business.  

Allah Ditta is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: improve his cow shed and buy fodder in bulk.

loans.name: Selave

texts.en:
Selave is a 45-year-old divorced woman with seven children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro, yam and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years.

Selave has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, bush knives and a shovel.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Selave hopes to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, bush knives and a shovel.

loans.name: Tofig

texts.en:
Tofig is a taxi driver. He has been married for 29 years and has six children. His elder son and elder daughter are married. One of his daughters studies at medical college, and the little daughter goes to school. His two sons go to school also. Tofig and his family are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city; for 21 years, they have lived in the Abseron region. To support his large family is so difficult. 

Today, Tofig wants to increase his business, and he wants to buy winter wheels for his car. For this reason, he has applied to Komak company for a loan in amount of 900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Tofig is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for the help. In the future, he wants to engage his children and have a grandchild.

loans.use: to buy winter wheels

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El socio continua dedicándose al negocio de restaurant y a la venta de cerveza, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio trabajan conjuntamente con su esposa en la preparación de distintos platos que solicitan sus clientes como pollo al horno, sopas entre otros, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como carnes, arroz, aceites entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to dedicate himself to his restaurant business as well as selling beer. He has operated this business for a long time, and it is going well for him thanks to the dedication he puts into his business each day. He works together with his wife to prepare various dishes which his customers request, such as baked chicken, soups, and others. He would like to keep working and in this way continue supporting his family. 

He is requesting the loan to buy supplies such as meat, rice, and oil, among other items. 

The borrower is grateful for the loan, and he is committed to making his loan payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as meat, rice, oil and other items.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 51-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be humble and loyal to customers. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables, fruits and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs for use on her farm. She hopes that, in the future, she will buy another piece of land for farming. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maria Victoria works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Victoria is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like noodles, meat, vegetables, etc., for her food vending business.

Ma. Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like noodles, meat, vegetables, etc., for her food vending business

loans.name: Hiram

texts.en:
Hiram is a single man. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, bread, milk and other items. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds.

He will use the 5,000 KES loan to add stock of sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items. He hopes that, in the future, he will succeed. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Sugra

texts.en:
Sugra is the age of 35 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children; three of them go to school.

Her husband has been running a restaurant successfully for many years and handling the financial conditions of his house. This restaurant has been cherished by her whole family for many years. Nowadays, he wants to offer more menu items to his valuable customers and wants to buy utensils, a cauldron, etc., so he could grow his income.

Sugra is taking a loan for the establishment of the restaurant. In fact, her husband wants to buy chicken, beef, bread, butter, yogurt, plastic furniture, spices, utensils, a cauldron, etc. She is hopeful that this loan would be the cause to enhance profits and savings as well.

Sugra thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy food items, utensils, a cauldron and plastic furniture for the restaurant

loans.name: Lea Nenet

texts.en:
Lea Nenet is 48 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Lea Nenet works very hard to provide for them.

Lea Nenet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lea Nenet has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Lea Nenet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a raising pigs business in the Philippines. Normelita has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Normelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Normelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
A $1,500 loan is offered to Eva to improve her business. She is married.  She opened her secondhand clothing business in 2007 with her own working capital of $1,000. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like children's wear, shirts, shorts, pants, underwear for pregnant women, short and long sleeved shirts. She is generating a good income from selling.  She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy children's wear, shirts, shorts, pants, underwear for pregnant women, short and long sleeved shirts

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married with three children. Anita  is 53 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines.

Anita  sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for seven years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to restock her store with basic goods.

Anita has been a member of PMPC for four years.  In the future, Anita hope to put up another business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic goods

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en:
Emmah is a 46-year-old single mother of one living in Thika. Her child is 24 years old. Emmah earns a living for her family by selling secondhand clothes.  She has been doing this business for the last ten years. This marks her fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya, due to limited income to fund her business. 

With the loan from VisionFund Kenya, she will be able to purchase more bales of clothes, which will expand her customer base, which in return will increase her sales and increase her profits, too. With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, she will pay college fees for her son and repay her loan. 

In future, Emmah would like to continue to invest in her son’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is married with four children. Elenita is 37 years old and lives in Canibungan Proper, Tudela, Philippines.

Elenita is a farmer and raises livestock to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to purchase a sack of feed.

Elenita has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Elenita hopes to provide her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of feed

loans.name: Bebita

texts.en:
Bebita is 45 years old and lives in Locsoon, Tudela, Philippines. She is married with five children. 

To earn a living, Bebita has a business selling soft drinks in the community. She earns about PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work. Bebita has requested a loan to buy cases of soft drinks to sell.

Bebita has been a member of PMPC for nine years.  In the future, Bebita would like to provide for her children's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a farmer living in the rich area of Eldoret. She has practiced farming for four years, in which she produces and sells milk, eggs, crops like vegetables, and maize. She enjoys mixed farming very much because it enables her to meet her family's needs. Her greatest challenges are lack of adequate funding and skills to boost her agribusiness.

Jackline chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan in order to access funding to purchase a dairy cow and feed. During the training session offered by the loan officers, she learned how to work in a group and also how to develop a culture of saving. 

Her highest monthly expense is family expenses and, therefore, this loan will enable her to purchase a dairy cow which will increase production. This will lead to more income and so, cater to her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and feed.

loans.name: M. Younus

texts.en:
M. Younus is 46-year-old married man living with his spouse and six children in the area of Lahore. 

He is a wholesaler of rice. He buys the rice from harvesters at low prices and sells in Lahore city to the retailers. He buys rice of various kinds such as basmati, super kernel, etc. He has been doing the same practice for many years and has many reputable retailers who like to buy rice from him in large quantity. In this tenure he has built up positive relationships with the retailers, and his customers have become like his advertisement as well.
 
He wants to buy rice in large quantity so he can easily cope with the rapid increase in customers and demand. In this way he would be able to increase his monthly income and savings as well. M. Younus praises for this honorable support; he thanks Kiva and field Partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk from harvesters for selling to the retailers.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hardworking and enterprising woman .She is a widow with two children.

Mercy owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her house has a leaking roof that she wants to repair.
 
With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase iron sheets, nails and timber for her roof. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets, nails and timber to repair her roof.

loans.name: Bada Thakura Shg Group

texts.en:
Bada Thakura Shg Self-Help Group consists of nine members who are all women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. 

A few years back, they all were facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start some business activities where they could provide the basic household consumables, vegetables, fruits, etc. to their customers.

One of them is Rangalata, the lady standing with raised hand in the picture, who was selected as their president. Rangalata is a 36-year-old lady living with her husband and her five children who are at their schooling. Her husband works as a laborer in a factory situated near her village. 

She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers, for which she has requested a loan.

She says on the behalf of the group, "We are grateful to the Kiva and its lenders for providing us this opportunity to grow."

loans.use: To purchase grocery items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables in bulk directly from the wholesalers.

loans.name: Phi

texts.en:
Phi is 41 years old, married, and has two children, a son and a daughter. 

He and his wife have been running a general store in front of their door for 18 years. He started this business to cover his expenses and to generate income to raise his children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Phi is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock his store. He hopes that this will enable him to attract more customers and that he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. He hopes that through the loan he will be able to expand his business activities and have money to reinvest in his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more household items and soft drinks to stock his store.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung, 53, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband, who works as a bricklayer. Dung earns money through sewing and making clothes. 

She is requesting this loan to buy a larger stock of material to make clothes and increase her production to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family will have a better future.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials to make clothes

loans.name: Cindy Camila

texts.es:
Ella se llama cindy camila, este año comenzara los estudios en el instituto campo alto en la carrera de cosmetologìa y estética integral, gracias al programa de kiva, quiere tener aprendizaje, desempeños, responsabilidades y sobre todo obtener resultados con el apoyo que me presta este programa.
La cosmetologìa y estética integral es uno de los mayores sueños de ella, es algo que le gusta mucho, sabe algunas cosas, ya que ha averiguado y asiste a estética para los masajes, lo cual le da la capacidad de llegar a saber mucho mas sobre lo que quiere para un futuro y sobre que trata todo lo de belleza, aparatologia y masajes en general.
Estudiar en campo alto es una gran oportunidad para ella, para poder desarrollar a un futuro lo que desea, no quiere quedarse como empleada, el mayor sueño, es tener su estética integral, hacer mayor el negocio, y poco a poco ir haciendo lo que mas le gusta, tiene el apoyo de los papas, ahora con el programa de kiva tiene el orgullo de llegar hasta donde quiere, quiere saber todo sobre la carrera, plantear para ella un futuro en la estética integral que tanto desea y quiere administrar.
texts.en:
Meet Cindy Camila, This year she started her studies at Campo Alto  in Cosmetology and Esthetics. Thanks to Kiva's support she hopes to receive better training, performance and responsibilities and moreover obtain better results with the help this program gives. Studying Cosmetology and Aesthetics is one of Cindy's main dreams, something she likes a lot and has some knowledge about. She has helped with massage treatments. All these things give her the capacity to learn much more about the field she wants for her future and about everything to do with health and beauty, and massage in general.

Studying at Campo Alto is a great opportunity for Cindy, allowing her to develop the future she desires. She doesn't want to be an employee. Her dream is to have her own esthetic salon, grow her business and little by little move towards doing what she likes most. She has the support of her parents and now with Kiva's support she has the satisfaction of getting to where she wants to go. She wants to know everything about this career, to plan a future for herself in Esthetics that she wants so much and she wants to manage.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Rasmiyya

texts.en:
Rasmiyya is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She is a confectioner, baking “paxlava,” “shekerbura,” and other national sweets. Her husband is a butcher. Her daughter finished school and helps with Rasmiyya's business and wants to learn this profession from her mother. 

Rasmiya’s family is from Agdam city. Twenty one years ago Agdam city was occupied by Armenians and since that time they are an IDP (internally displaced persons). Resmiya is requesting a loan for 2,300 AZN, which she will use to buy a refrigerator and an oven to increase her business. In the future she wants to open a bakery shop.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and an oven

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is 34 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as chicken, noodles, rice, flour, etc. She has been doing this for many years.

Angelica needs a loan to buy boxes of chicken, torch batteries, candles, noodles, matches, rice, flour and dripping oil. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, torch (flashlight) batteries, candles, noodles, matches, rice, flour and dripping oil

loans.name: Gadabwe

texts.en:
Gadabwe is a 28-year-old woman who is married with two children. She runs a business selling rice, chicken, sausages, milk, etc. in her community. She has six years of experience with this business.

Gadabwe has requested a loan to buy milk, sugar, noodles, mosquito coils, snacks, soft drinks and chicken. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2006.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, noodles, mosquito coils, snacks, soft drinks and chicken

loans.name: Ivapene

texts.en: Ivapene is a 49-year-old woman who is married with 7 children. She has a small business, sewing. She has many years of experience with this business. Ivapene needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, needles, oil and thread. She will use her profits to improve her business. Ivapene joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, needles, oil and thread.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 47 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Elsa is the sole bread winner earning a living from her mini grocery store and she earns approximately PHP8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products for retailing. 

Elsa has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. She is very active and supportive of all the programs and services of the cooperative.  In the future Elsa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is a 32-year-old married man. He has one child. 

He operates a grocery store where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area of good potential and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as perishability of the products he sells. 

He will use the KES 10,000 loan to add stock of vegetables and fruits. His business goal is to be a wholesaler of vegetables and fruits within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling purified water in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of purified water to sell to customers.

Melba successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Melba's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of purified water to sell.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is 35 years old and lives in Nakuru. She is married to Maurice and they are blessed with three children, aged 14, 8 and 5 years old.

She has been running her business of selling shoes for the last four years. It gives her an income of KES 45,000.

To enable her to buy more stocks of shoes so as to maximize her profits, she has applied for her third loan of KES 35,000 from Vision Fund Kenya.

She has serviced her previous loan successfully and she hopes to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to to pay school fees for her children, expand her business and pay back her loan to Vision Fund Kenya.

In the future, Selina hopes to be the main supplier of shoes to other sellers.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of shoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lesinko

texts.en:
Lesinko's farming business has been doing well and he has successfully paid off his previous loan of KES 40,000. He is able to pay school fees for his children from the farming proceeds. He has now been advanced a third loan of KES 60,000 which will enable him to cultivate a larger piece of land this season. 

He plans to plough back the proceeds until all his huge piece of idle land is utilised. Lesinko is a hardworking gentleman who is determined to excel in his venture. 

He hopes and dreams of growing the business to a large commercial venture as well as educating his children to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to prepare the land for the planting season.

loans.name: Senie

texts.en:
Senie works hard to support three children. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Senie requested a PHP 4,600 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have back-up light, in case of emergency.

Senie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 34 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is in school. Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Petche Louie

texts.en:
Petche Louie works hard to support her three children. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Petche Louie requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have back-up light in case of emergency.

Petche Louie is aware that, by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s tuition fee at the university.

loans.name: Paata

texts.en:
Paata, age 32, is from the village of Tserovani. He is married and has two toddler children. Paata’s mother lives with his family, as well. Paata’s mother works at the local culture house, as an accountant, and his wife is a cleaner in the same institution. 

Their salaries are modest and hardly enough to cover feeding and household expenses. To improve their earnings, the family decided to start a bakery in their yard, to bake bread. They've already built the building, but they need additional funds to purchase pastry-making equipment. 

Paata hopes his project will be profitable since he lives on a crowded street and similar bakeries are not located nearby. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy pastry-making equipment, to start a bakery.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh, 55 years old, is widowed and has three daughters. She supports her family with the income she earns from selling food from her stall. She has had this business for 17 years. She and her children live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Thanh intends to use the loan to upgrade and repair her food stall. The additional capital will enable her to decorate her stall better, and that will attract more new customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To upgrade and repair her food stall.

loans.name: Ton

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Thom province’s Brosat Balang district, Ton is age 27 years and married. He has two children to take care of. To feed his family, he has worked hard for several years as a farmer who grows cassava. To add up more income, his wife also sells grocery items.
 
Ton has been with VisionFund for five cycles. Now he is asking for a loan to pay for his university education to study management. He hopes this loan will enable him to attend university.

loans.use: to pay for his university to study management.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is  taking a loan of USD 1,200 to improve her business. She is married and she has seven children. 

Isabel is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as fish, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Pan, and Break. 

She opened her kiosk a year ago, with her own working capital of USD 500.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Pan, and Break for her kiosk.

loans.name: Kiran's Group

texts.en:
Kiran, age 22, is wearing a green dress in the given picture. 

Her husband is a vegetable supplier who has supplied the vegetable market in a nearby town for many years. Her husband brings vegetables from the field and supplies to the retailers. He has been feeding his children and old parents from generated income from this business. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase the stock on a daily basis so that he can do maximum sales.
