The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer for growing maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is married with three children. He is 54 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

Ramon operates his own sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month, he earns PHP 20,000 doing this type of business. Recently, he applied for a loan to buy more sacks of rice and corn and more grocery items for additional display in his sari-sari store.

He has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Ramon hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice and corn and more grocery items for his sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mirza

texts.en: Mirza is a 37-year-old, married man from Samtredia city. He lives with his wife, two school-aged daughters and little son.  Mirza's wife is a private teacher and generates approximately 300 GEL monthly. This is the only source of income for the family nowadays.  For lack of economic resources,  Mirza was unable to get higher education. That’s why he can't find any stable job. So Mirza decided to start his own private business to generate some income. He applied for the credit with MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.  A loan of $1,200 will help Mirza to start a car trading business. He will purchase cars abroad at low prices, and will sell them locally at a good price. He will start his business with selling his own car and add this money to the requested loan. Misha is a very enthusiastic and motivated person, with a great desire to ensure his children with a good education for progressing in life. This credit will be a great support for the family. Mirza is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to start a car trading business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a milk cow to expand her farm and provide additional dairy products to her family and community.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and five children in Gaza .
She works at a workshop for sewing. Her life conditions prevented her from completing her higher education. She hopes someday to start her education again.

Muna applied for a loan from Ryada to repair the closet of her kitchen and for painting her house, which will enable her family to live with more psychological comfort. This will help her to improve her house and make it better. 

She is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to repair the closet of the kitchen and paint her house.

loans.name: Boymurod

texts.en: Boymurod is a Tajik man who lives in a mountainous area. He is a careful father of 3 young children who go to school. Boymurod’s wife is a housewife, so he is the family's sole provider. Boymurod 4 years ago began an animal husbandry business with 3 goats. Now, he has 30 goats on the land where his house is, and they come into part of the house to be fed. He began building additional rooms on his house some years ago but does not have the money to finish them. He is asking for a loan of 1500 USD to buy building materials such as as cement and bricks for house building. He awaits your support and  thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy home-building materials like cement and bricks.

loans.name: Hatua Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her mid-thirties, is married with three sons and a daughter who are in school. For two years now, Halima has been running a shop selling dry food products like beans, rice, baking flour, maize flour, powdered and bar soaps, airtime, etc. She is fine with this project. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. each day and is able to make a fair monthly return. 

This will be her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Halima used her previous loans to buy business stock of soft drinks, rice, beans, and soaps of different kinds.  She has successfully paid back all her previous loans. With her profits, Halima covered school fees and household expenses and saved. She will use this loan to buy a refrigerator and soft drinks for her shop. Halima dreams that one day she will be able to grow her business more than before. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, HATUA, which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and soft drinks for her shop.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El señor Hugo tiene 26 años, es horticultor independiente hace 3 años, ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a esta misma actividad pero como empleado. El señor Hugo es de la ciudad de Itá, vive en pareja con la señora Ursulina quien es empleada doméstica, tienen 1 hijo de 5 años quien es el motivo de lucha de este pareja.
Hugo realiza plantación de todo tipo de verdeos en terrenos familiares como ser perejil, Kuratú, acelga, lechuga, espinaca lo cuales comercializa con distribuidores al por mayor quienes vuelven a vender a supermercados de la capital y alrededores.
Este préstamo lo quiere invertir en la compra de insumos para su huerta, como abonos y semillas y también para la compra de media sombra que le son de suma utilidad en esta época del año.
texts.en:
Hugo, 26, has been an independent horticulturist for three years; previously he was employed at this trade. Hugo is from Itá and lives with his wife Ursulina, who is a housekeeper. They have a five-year-old son, who is their reason for working hard. 

Hugo grows many kinds of greens, such as parsley, cilantro, chard, lettuce, and spinach, on the family land to sell to wholesale brokers that resell to supermarkets in the capital and surrounding area. He will use this loan to buy supplies like manure, seed, and shading, which is very useful at this time of year, for his market garden.

loans.use: to buy supplies like manure, seed, and shading.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a clothes inventory from Erlian, China to sell at her rental stall at the local market.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en: Kamel is a 59-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. Despite his older age, he keeps on working unfailingly day after day to be able to support his family money-wise. His work consists of cutting firewood and selling it to customers so they can stay warm during the winter season. Presently, Kamel is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase required materials and tools that will keep his operations running smoothly. This will be his first Kiva loan and he is certain that it will help him to greatly expand his business, which will return higher profits for him.

loans.use: to purchase required materials and tools for cutting and selling firewood.

loans.name: Gulsora

texts.en:
Gulsora is 56 years old, hardworking, and dedicated to her own business. She is married and has some children. She has been busy growing vegetables and crops. She grows onions, wheat, and crops. She chose this business because it is profitable and her fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made of vegetables.

Gulsora sells her crops in the local market. Her husband Karimjon actively helps her to raise the crops and vegetables. As these products are in high demand, she wants to expand her business and produce more crops and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose she applied for a loan of 3000 TJS. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Emel

texts.en:
Emel is married with one child.  When she retired and moved out of Istanbul, she did not know anyone there and was lonely.  One day, when she was wandering along the shore, she saw people who were selling jewelry and decided to learn this trade.  She got help from those people to learn how to make jewelry. She also learned from CD's and books.  

She opened her stall five years ago on the shore.  She made new friends through her work.  She will buy a variety of beads, different types of stones and necessary materials with the loan.  She believes that she may earn more income if she can make more varieties of jewelry and sell them.  She wishes for health and peace in the future. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Emel Hanım,evli  ve 1 çocuğu var.  Emekli olup İstanbul’dan taşındığı yerde,hiç kimseyi tanımıyormuş ve boşlukta kalmış.  Bir gün sahili gezerken, takı satan arkadaşları görmüş ve  bu işi yapmaya karar vermiş.  Takı yapmayı öğrenmek için arkadaslardan yardım almış.  CD lerden ,kitaplardan takı yapımını öğrenmiş.  Beş yıl önce Sahilde tezgah açarak bu işe başlamış.  Çalışarak arkadaş çevresinin genişlediğini söylüyor.  Aldığı kredi ile boncuk çeşitleri,değişik çeşit taşlar ve takı yapımında kullanılan malzemeler alacak.  Ne kadar çok çeşidi olursa o kadar çok satış yapacağını ve gelirinin artacağını düşünüyor.
Gelecek de ,bundan sonra sağlık ve huzur istiyor.

loans.use: to buy  beads and different types of stones to make jewelry

loans.name: Loida

texts.en: Loida manages a retail business in her village. She sells soft drinks, canned goods and breads. With her desire to make her income greater than her usual income, she also sells mobile phone credits. Loida wants to invest in additional products, but she doesn't have the funds to pursue this. Loida is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy additional grocery items and beverages to sell. She plans to use the increased income from her business to invest in a livestock business, which she hopes will eventually be a great source of income for her.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Jose Geovanny

texts.es: José, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 1 hijo, reside en Tocoa, Colon. José hace 6 años que alquila un local en el mercado donde tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa nueva como pantalones, vestidos, blusas, camisetas, calzado, gorras, CD, fajas, sombreros, radios etc. siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. también tiene otra actividad de venta de comida que administra su esposa. Esta solicitando el noveno  ciclo de préstamo con la institución el cual es por 30,000 Lempiras para invertir en la compra de zapatos, gorras y ropa para damas caballeros y niños, para aumentar el inventario. Su plan es poder comprar un vehículo para el negocio.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his wife and son in Tocoa, Colón. For six years now he has rented a space in the market where he has his own business selling new clothing, such as pants, dresses, blouses, T-shirts, footwear, “fajas” [girdles] and hats, as well as CDs and radios. He has always worked in sales. José also has a food sales business that is run by his wife.

José is requesting this loan of 30,000 HNL to buy shoes, caps and clothing for women, men and children, to increase his inventory. This is his ninth loan cycle with the field partner. José’s goal is to be able to buy a vehicle to use in his business.

loans.use: to buy shoes, caps and clothing for women, men and children, to be sold in his business.

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en:
Because Haifa is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Haifa was born in 1982. She is a mother of three, living in a sector in Jordan called Karak. Her husband is a lieutenant. 

Haifa was facing a financial crisis that led her to start a new project selling goats and their products five years ago. She is planning to buy a larger quantity of goats and sheep in order to be more productive and to earn better profit, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more goats and sheep for her business

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung, 24, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two daughters, one son and her husband. Nhung earns money through sewing clothing. Her husband earns a living as a stainless steel polisher. Nhung would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of sewing material to better meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of sewing material to better meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad  is 19 years old and works as employee at a supermarket in his neighborhood. He lives with his family  in  Ramallah-Ramallah, a Palestinian city, the center of Ramallah and al-Bireh, located in the West Bank.

Mohammad asked Ryada for this loan in order to paint his house and extend electricity at his home; this will bring better living conditions. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to paint his house and extend electricity

loans.name: Elvis Fernando

texts.es:
Elvis tiene 21 años de edad vive en Union Libre  tiene tres hijos vive con los padres con la compañera y con los hios pequeños en casa de ellos,vive en en el Canton Mocache Perteneciente a la Provicncia de los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Sara Guerrero, perteneciente al Canton Mocache se dedican a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias.

Elvis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz trabaja en terrenos de los padres. Las compras las realiza en Mocache en la feria de los dias Jueves.

Con el dinero ha podido cubrir algunas necesidades como el pago de la mano de obra y adquir algunos insumos.El credito solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas, semillas y una bomba para fumigar. 

La meta es seguir trabajando y tener mayores ingresos para seguir invirtiendo y comprar un terreno para constriuir la casa para la familia. En los tiepos libres le gusta hacer deporte y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Elvis is 21 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He has three children and lives in his parents' house with his partner and small children. He lives in the Mocache canton of the Los Rios province. His loan group is called '27 de octubre' and is located in the Sara Guerrero precinct in the Mocache canton, where residents make a living from agricultural work and livestock.

Elvis makes a living from agriculture, growing corn. He works on his parents' land. He will make the purchases in Mocache at the market on Thursdays. With the money he has been able to cover some of his expenses, such as paying for labor and buying some supplies. He is asking for the loan to buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides, seeds and a pump to fumigate.

Elvis' goal is to keep working and have more income to keep investing and buying land to build a house for his family. In his free time he likes to play sports and spend time with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides, seeds and a pump to fumigate

loans.name: Om-Ebrahim Group

texts.en: This group is called Om-Ebrahim and consists of four women. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 Yemen rials (YER) from AMB. Afaf is 33 years old and is a married woman with children. She is a hairdresser whose customers are women. She has been talented from a young age at work in her field. She is an industrious individual who has been working for many years. Although she has acquired many customers, her income is not enough to cover what she needs.  She is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB so that she can buy home appliances to use for her house. She hopes to improve and expand her business in order to increase her profit. She is grateful for the assistance she has received.

loans.use: to  buy home appliances.

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil is a 26-year-old man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a driver and earns a daily income. He works hard to provide a good life for his family. Most of the money he makes is spent to raise his family. His house is very old and needs to be renovated. The house is likely to collapse at any time. He knows that renovation is a costly process. He has started renovating his house but needs additional money. He needs to complete the renovation, so he asked for a loan to buy construction supplies. 

He hopes that after the renovation is completed, he and his family will feel safe in the house. He dreams of opening a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to renovate his home.

loans.name: Sokunthea's Group

texts.en:
Sokunthea, a mother of two small children, resides in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 28 years old and a farmer who does rice cropping as the primary source of income. During her spare time, she also works for others for a fee to supplement her income. Sokunthea has engaged in her current business for several years and currently she is able to earn up to 32,000 KHR per day. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), this is the third loan for Sokunthea and one of her co-borrowers and the seventh-cycle loan for the remaining two borrowers in the group. Sokunthea has made a successful repayment for her past two cycles which has helped her to uplift her living condition gradually. Now, she and her co-borrowers are seeking for 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer and rice seeds to be ready for replanting reason. She hopes that she can gain a good yield from her crop so that she can double her income.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer and rice seeds to be ready for the replanting reason.

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from Battambang province, Thol is a father of six children. He is in his late 50s. Nowadays, he still needs to support his five children as they are still in school. To secure the daily cost of living for his big family, he not only manages vegetable gardens but also plants chili peppers and pineapples. These businesses have returned to him about 38,000 KHR per day. 

Thol has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). It is also the first loan for his co-borrower in a group consisting of two. Both members of the group are seeking 600,000 KHR. As the leader, Thol will spend his entire loan portion to buy good seeds as well as vegetable seedlings and fertilizer for his pineapples. He hopes that he will double last year's yield.

loans.use: to buy good seeds as well as vegetable seedlings and fertilizer for his pineapples.

loans.name: Allaberdy

texts.en:
Allaberdy is a young and purposeful man. He is 23 years old. Allaberdy is not married and lives with his parents, brother and sister. He doesn't have a higher education. Allaberdy has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 2 years. He began his business with 3 sheep. Nowadays, Allaberdy runs his business well and successfully.  

He wants to repair his living house but does not have enough savings. He is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, paint, wood, etc., for repairing his house. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials as cement, paint, wood, etc., for repairing the house

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed has a mini bus and has been running a transportation business for the past 10 years.  Jamshed transports people from his village to the center of the region. Jamshed works hard to earn money to provide his 3 children and wife with all necessary things.  Little by little, Jamshed has developed his business. 

He is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy a new mini bus, to attract more clients.  He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a mini bus

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell more smoked fish.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de regalos como peluches,perfumes y juguetes,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia tambien trabaja en un hotel,por medios de estos negocios la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de regalos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar peluches,perfumes y juguetes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to earn her living selling gifts like stuffed animals, perfumes, and toys. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.; she also works in a hotel. Through these jobs, the member hopes to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her gift sales business. 

The member is requesting the loan to buy stuffed animals, perfumes, and toys. She is happy about the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase stuffed animals, perfumes, and toys.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Activas está en el 2do ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, además de ello forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas quieren mejorar su calidad de vida, y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Anunciacion, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos bajos, pero ella se esfuerza por poder crecer y mejorar su vida. Ella tiene una despensa la cual con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo montar y hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela, y gracias a su trabajo y empeño del día a día pudo mejorar bastante su calidad de vida. Hoy pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, carne, hortalizas y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que ellas están recibiendo.
texts.en: Mujeres Activas [Active Women] is in its second cycle of the women's communal bank program.  They are also part of the poverty elimination program, where they all want to improve their quality of life and thus be able to help their families.  One of the members is Anunciacion, who on her last survey showed a level one level of poverty, which means she has a low income.  However, she works to be able to grow and improve her life.  She has a store which, with a lot of effort and sacrifice, she was able to open, and now she has a very good clientele.  Thanks to her work and determination every day, she was able to improve her quality of life substantially.  Today she requests this loan to spend on supplies for her store, such as greens, fruit, meat, vegetables, etc.  She is thankful that she and the other women have this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy supplies to sell, such as greens, fruit, meat, and vegetables, among others

loans.name: G.s. Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El g.s. Fe y Esperanza está conformado por tres integrantes dos mujeres y un hombre madres y padres responsable con cinco hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de la zona central del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañia de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no curso su carrera y se vieron obligados  a trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles estabilidad y mejores condiciones a sus pequeños hijos.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Marisol y tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa como camisas, ropa interior, pantalones, shores, faldas. Ella dedica  a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su mercadería de forma ambulante a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y aprovechar la temporada navideña donde la venta se incrementa y así en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  El g.s. Fe y esperanza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  apersonas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es  Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Fe y Esperanza [Faith and Hope] communal bank has three members, two women and a man, who are the parents of five dependent children. They were born in central Nicaragua and are hardworking, responsible people who want to be successful. They like to spend their free time with their children. Sadly, they lacked money to study for a profession and had to start working at an early age. They strive every day to offer stability and a higher standard of living to their young children.

With effort and the desire to get ahead, Marisol serves as the group coordinator and also sells clothing such as shirts, underwear, pants, shorts, and skirts. She works about 10 hours each day selling her merchandise as a street vendor to regular and potential clients. She will use this loan as working capital to take advantage of the Christmas season, when sales are strong, so that she can earn more money soon.  Fe y Esperanza communal bank thanks Kiva lenders for the support they offer to low-income people in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have decent work.

loans.use: to stock more merchandise for her clothing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish.

loans.name: Attaa'

texts.en:
Attaa' is 19-years-old.  She has four brothers; she lives with her family near Nablus.  She works at a work shop for sewing clothes near her house.

Attaa' applied for a loan from Ryada to repair the closet and pay for plumbing work for the bathroom to prevent the water from leaking.  This will help her to improve the house and make it better. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to repair the closet and pay for plumbing work.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en: Dionesia is married with four children. She manages her food-vending business while her husband does farming. She has been doing this for many years and it helps the family a lot. She took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy raw ingredients to prepare grilled foods. This picture of Dionesia was taken with her assistant while they were preparing stuff to cook. She wants to improve her business and improve the general living of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare grilled foods

loans.name: Godebelthe

texts.en: Godebelthe is 58 years old. She is married to a businessman. She sells various foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more maize, beans and sorghum for sale. With the profits from the business, she will save more money.

loans.use: To buy more maize, beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is 50 years old. She is married with three children, ages six to twenty-three.  With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and sorghum to sell. She has a plan to use the profits for providing food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Bunkhann

texts.en:
Bunkhann, aged 31, lives with his wife and a school-going child in Stueng Saen district of Kampong Thom province. He works with great effort as a farmer on his own land, primarily growing rice. His wife is very helpful and helps him with the farming works in every harvest season.  He has been doing this work for nearly five years, and thanks to this he has been able to raise his family. His wife was photographed with him in the picture. 

In order to meet the needs of his family, Bunkhann is taking out a loan of KHR 2,000,000 as working capital to buy rice to stock for future sales. During the harvest season, he is able to buy rice at a cheap price from local villagers and will be able to sell it at a profit in the high demand season. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their goodwill and generosities towards low-income people like him to improve his business and develop his living conditions accordingly.

loans.use: to buy rice to stock for the future sales.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en: Mwanamkuu appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards, and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a single, 34-year-old mother of one in Mwingi, Kenya. Her child is 12 years old. Elizabeth operates a food stall. She has been running the business for the past four years with a monthly income of 5,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

Elizabeth is applying for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya after she was introduced by an existing client. She will use the loan to purchase wheat flour, kale, cereal, onions and cabbage in bulk for her stall. She will reinvest the proceeds back into the business and repay her loan. 

She hopes to educate her child up to college level and secure his future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, kale, cereal, onions and cabbage in bulk

loans.name: Asmani's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of seven group leader farmers in Kakamega North district, with Asmani selected as the Kiva representative. Asmani has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and he is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to his and the 71 other individual farmers represented by this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here, but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Asmani is 63 years old and has been a farmer for 40 years. Asmani works as a farmer to provide for his five children. The community and other farmers know Asmani as friendly, hardworking, reliable, and trustworthy. Besides farming, he is also involved in his community, such as the savings group and prayer group. Asmani described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

Asmani joined One Acre Fund in 2009, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Asmani joined One Acre Fund so that he can get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, and earn enough to feed his family. Because he is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Asmani has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Asmani's life because he has more profits from his harvest, and was able to feed the family. In the future, Asmani hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and invest in a business.  				

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low, and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Asmani and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer packages from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues to provide training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With the support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock like groceries.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 55 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Gertrudes operates a rug making business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Gertrudes is requesting a loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more materials for her business. In the future, Gertrudes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Yat, 38 years old, is the breadwinner of the family, which consists of three children, two of whom count on her as they are still in school. For the past 10 years, Yat has operated a business growing cassava and rice and raising pigs. 

Yat is quite new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has teamed up a group of two to get a first time loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Yat will spend her entire loan portion to buy pig feed and to pay for harvesting. She hopes that she can raise her pigs healthily so that she will get a good selling price.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and to pay for harvesting

loans.name: Pheobie

texts.en:
Pheobie is 28-years-old and married with one child. When she was in high school, she received training in metal work and realized she could put her talent to use earning a living. Now she is an inspiring entrepreneur who is currently running a welding business. Pheobie makes window frames, door frames and metal stoves which she sells to her community. She even supplies informal construction companies. Additionally, Pheobie leads campaigns to mentor and empower young women in her community. 

Pheobie will use the Kiva loan to grow her business by purchasing metal sheets, steel rods and a welding machine. Additional income will bring stability to her business and her life. It will also enable her to secure her child’s education as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more metal sheets, steel rods and a welding machine for her products.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is a 30-year-old single woman living in Wedza, Zimbabwe. She trains young women in life skills education, leadership and entrepreneurship and is well-known in her community for her work in women’s empowerment. She is currently running a phone credit/airtime for local network couriers. She started the business in 2011 when mobile phones became increasingly popular in Zimbabwe.

She really loves her business and she feels it has the potential to transform into something big. A Kiva loan will assist her in expanding the business. She intends to use it to purchase a vending machine to sell electronic cell phone calling credit. That way she will be able to reduce costs of procuring the pay-as-you-go scratch cards. An improvement in the business means that she will be able to pay for college fees for her two siblings.

loans.use: To purchase vending machine to sell electronic cell phone calling credit

loans.name: Seab's Group

texts.en:
Seab, a widowed mother of three children, is in her early 50s. She is a resident of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district. For her family, rice farming is the main source of income. She also works for others for a fee to supplement her income. Nowadays, she can earn almost 40,000 KHR per day from the business that she has had for five years. 

Including this loan, Seab and her joint borrowers are in the second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her first loan, which she has repaid back completely, has enabled her to improve her living conditions gradually. Now, she is a leader of her group. She requests a loan amount of 300,000 KHR. Her co-borrower requests 400,000 KHR. Seab will spend her loan portion mainly to buy fertilizer. She hopes that she can wisely manage her loan to boost her crop yield so as she can make more profit from her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah is a 24-year-old, single woman, living in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. Linah is an aspiring entrepreneur, who inspires other women in her community to be financially independent.  She started her poultry business in 2012, after noticing an increase in demand for Rhode Island chickens with lean meat. She currently produces about 100 chickens every six weeks and sells them to local customers.

Linah knows that she could sell more chickens each month if she used her profits to buy more supplies. However, almost all of her current income is needed to provide for two children who are dependent upon her. With this Kiva loan, Linah will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and chick feed, which will enable her to increase production. With this investment in her business, her profits will increase, and she will be able to care for her two dependents and keep them in school.

loans.use: to buy broiler chicks and chick feed, and increase production

loans.name: M. Ijaz

texts.en:
M. Ijaz owns an automobile spare parts shop in Lahore, Pakistan and lives near his shop. His shop is situated in the vehicle spare parts market and it is a challenge for him to sell his product among his competitors. This competition highly affects his daily sales. To grow his business and income, and to have an edge over his competitors he has decided to offer some additional and stylish spare parts. He hopes that this strategy will work positively and customers will be attracted to his new products.

He would not have been able to implement his strategy without some capital, and had therefore requested for a loan from the Kiva’s field partner with which he purchased the additional spare parts. M. Ijaz is tension free after taking the loan because BRAC showed him a beam of hope in the darkness. He is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy automobile spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en: Ararat is from Vanadzor town. He has been running a food store where he trades with fruits and vegetables for over a year. He purchases products from nearby open markets and sells them to his customers in Vanadzor town.  Ararat lives together with his parents, and his brother and sister. The income that he gathers from his retail business is important for the family's living. Therefore, Ararat applied for this loan to be able to purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell in his store.  He has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately, wasn't able to pay it back.  However, thanks to his hard work during the last year, Ararat was able to run his business in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments.  So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. The loan will be a huge support for this young man to continue his business, and to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and vegetables to sell in his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education

loans.name: Maysaa

texts.en:
Maysaa is a 36-year-old single woman who has operated a clothing sales shop for five years. She is the sole breadwinner to one additional member of her family. 

Maysaa is a hard worker with a very good reputation in her region for the special quality of her products and for the special prices she provides. Maysaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special Christmas and winter newly-released items. She will also add necessary decorations to her shop and paste floor tiles to keep her shop attractive enough to her customers.

Maysaa is working hard to make sure that her business will provide her with sustainability. She will make sure that she develops it by diversifying her products and improving her living.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise and to improve her shop

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is married and has six children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal. She has been in this business for the last 8 years. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to get more capital in order to expand her business from a retail to a wholesale business. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is married with two children and one of her children goes to school.  She doesn’t take care of any additional family members.  She has a tailoring business and has been in this business for three years. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works in a shop six days out of every week. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a tailoring school and become a wholesaler.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying rent.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads.

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en: Komiljon was born in 1980. He is married and has four children. Komiljon’s children are not adults. He lives with his wife and children in a rural area. His wife is a housewife. Komiljon has been busy with his taxi service for more than seven years. Komiljon has an OPEL car. He tries to provide a high quality service. He is going to repair his house because it is in a bad condition. He is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc for repairing his house. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fabrics to make dresses for sale and and to buy additional sewing machines in order to expand her business and meet rising customers' demands.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An is 42 years old and an experienced farmer from Tamao village of Kampong Siem, Kampong Cham. She lives together with her husband and a single child, while her oldest child lives separately with her new family. 

An owns a few plots of land, where she manages to cultivate rice and other seasonal crops to earn a living. 

With little income from farming, An hasn’t been able to save enough money to care for the needs of her family, so at this time she is asking for a loan of USD 1,000 to buy a piece of land to expand her farming area and improve farming productivity. 

Realizing the importance of the income that An gathers from agribusiness, the loan will greatly assist An to enlarge the farm and ensure a better life for her family. She will be very grateful to the lenders for a constant support.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land to expand her farming area and improve farming productivity.

loans.name: Marcia Del Socorro

texts.es: Marcia del socorro mayor de edad con cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la música de sus tiempos al igual que la compañía de sus nietos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la pobreza en la que Vivían no pudo cursar sus estudios, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante esta microempresaria se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa, cosméticos, zapatos entre otros al igual que tiene una pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo para el hogar como: granos básicos, productos congelados entre otros ubicado en su  casa de habitación. Marcia inicia sus jornadas diarias desde muy temprano ofreciendo sus productos y su mercadería en general, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.el objetivo de este financiamiento es para la compra de capital de trabajo para surtir sus negocios como: variedades estilos de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, productos congelados, granos básicos, golosinas entre otros para así abastecer a sus clientes de nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Marcia del Socorro is an older woman with four children who are all grown up. She is originally from the city of Chinandega, located in the west of the country.

She is known for being hardworking and responsible, with a goal of self-improvement. In her free time, she likes enjoying music from her time, as well as the company of her grandchildren.

Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources and the poverty she lived in, she was not able to complete her studies, and had to go work from a young age to help with household expenses. 

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, this microentrepreneur earns her living buying and selling general merchandise, such as various types of clothing, cosmetics and shoes among others. She also has a general store located in her house where she offers products for household consumption, such as staple grains and frozen products, among others.

Marcia starts her days very early, offering her products and general merchandise, so she can earn a better income in the not-too-distant future. 

The goal of this loan is for working capital to stock her business: various styles of clothing, shoes, cosmetics, frozen products, staple grains, sweets and others to deliver new products to her clients.

loans.use: to buy household consumption products for her general store such as: staple grains, frozen products, detergents, soap, various clothing styles and shoes, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of frozen beef, chicken, and fish.

loans.name: Sadinisso

texts.en:
Born in 1959, Sadinisso was widowed early in her married life and has raised her four children alone. She has been engaged in an animal husbandry business for more than 15 years. She owns land by her house where she grows corn for her cattle, and she earns an income by selling milk and kefir to members of her local community. 

At the present time, Sadinisso's son is about to get married, and Sadinisso does not have enough money to organize the wedding party. She is therefore asking for a loan in the amount of 7,500 Somoni, which she will use to prepare a wedding party for her son and future daughter-in-law. 

She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to organize her son's wedding party

loans.name: Rayhona

texts.en:
Rayhona is a hard-working woman. She is married and does not have any children. 

She has had her own business for more than six years. Rayhona buys fruits and vegetables from one region and sells them in another region. Her husband helps her with managing the business. 

Step-by-step, Rayhona has developed her business. She wants to buy a mini-bus for transporting goods and, in this way, to make faster the cycle of buying and selling. She is asking for a loan of USD 1,500 to buy a mini-bus. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a mini-bus for her business.

loans.name: Dania Rosario

texts.es:
Dania de 55 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo mayor de edad, es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Ella se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de salir adelante. Como madre  soltera ha superado los obstáculos y adversidades y puso sacar adelante a su hijo, y brindarles mejores posibilidades a través de su trabajo y esfuerzo, para que en un futuro tenga un mejor futuro a través de sus estudios universitarios.

Gracias s su tenacidad, y sus ganas de superación personal tiene  por actividad económica la venta de cosmeticos y  prendas de oro y  plata de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con variedad de  cosmeticos como crema, rubor, perfumes, labiales, desmaquilladoras y  prendas de oro y platas como: anillos, aretes, pulseras, dijes, omegas, brazaletes,  ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y tiene mayor demanda de sus clientes.  Dania agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Dania, 55, is the single mother of an adult son. She was born in El Sauce in northern Nicaragua. She is hardworking and responsible and wants to succeed. She has overcome obstacles and adversity to provide for her son. With work and effort, she has given him the opportunity to have a bright future  through his college education.

Thanks to her tenacity and desire to succeed, she runs a business selling cosmetics and gold and silver jewelry as a street vendor and in her house. She works eight hours a day. She will use this loan to stock a variety of cosmetics, such as creams, blush, perfumes, lipsticks, and cotton pads, and gold and silver jewelry, such as rings, earrings, bracelets, necklaces, watches, and bangles, for the coming Christmas season when demand is strong. Dania thanks the Kiva lenders for the support they offer to low-income people in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have decent work.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and gold and silver jewelry like rings, earrings, bracelets, necklaces, watches, and bangles for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal, bags of maize and rice, assorted drinks, radio, and different types of batteries.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en: Gulshan is 28 years old. She is divorced and lives with her parents. Gulshan is going to organize her own sewing business. She had no opportunity or money, but she came to IMON with this plan and here she found support. She studied the women's organization course ‘To Get Ahead’ and got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy fabric and a sewing machine for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine for organizing a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an additional electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, a married mother of four children, three of whom go to school, lives in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food.

Maria has operated a food stall at the market for the last five years, and she works six days a week. Her major business challenges are seasonality and fluctuating prices. 

Maria has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy a box of tomatoes, onions, oranges, sweet potatoes and passion fruits. Her goals are to get more capital for expansion and also to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, oranges, sweet potatoes and passion fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase silver and gold to meet customers' orders on time

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase insulation and construction materials to finish building his house for his family

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines (makes tires more durable), and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Emma is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing shop.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing.

loans.name: Gbessay

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Gbessay.  He is married and has two children, aged one and six. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to help the wife's younger sister with her education. In 2010, Gbessay established his photocopying, printing, stationary and drinks business. He began his business to add to his income as lecturer of a tertiary institution. His business is located in the outskirt and his main customers are adults.

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,420,400 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Gbessay has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy stationary. He hopes that this loan can increase the stock and expand the business. In the future, Gbessay plans to improve the business and expand to sale on recharge cards. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for stationary

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
This is forty-seven year-old Mahmoud.  He is married and has three children aged five, twenty and twenty-one. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to help in the business. In 1992, Mahmoud established his suitcases, school bags, briefcases and travelling boxes business. He began his business to be self-reliant after coming from the mines. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults.

Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 1,804,200 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mahmoud has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional travelling boxes. He hopes that this loan can increase the stock and expand the business. In the future, Mahmoud plans to improve the business and expand to the outskirt of town. He thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy travelling boxes.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena is a widow and solely provides the family needs. She earns well from her general store where she has been selling assorted groceries for more than five years. She took a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She always maintains good relations with her clients and wants to improve her business to have a better source of income for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, 33, a resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines. She is married to Jovienes, a construction worker. They have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Vilma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also has a direct sales business and sells frozen foods for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,100 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also use the loan to buy merchandise products for her direct sales business.

Vilma dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is a 41-year-old married father of 3 children, ages 9, 14, and 16 years old. He is from Thika and practices dairy farming with his wife, Jane. Josephat has been in the farming business for the past four years. He earns a monthly income of KES 21,500, which he uses to support his family.

This marks his third loan term with VisionFund Kenya, after successfully repaying his previous loans. He will use the loan to buy another dairy cow and animal feed for his cows. The additional income created will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family and to reinvest the remaining amount in his business.

In the future, Josephat would like to buy more dairy cows. He hopes to save money to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow and animal feed.

loans.name: Silvana Lourdes

texts.es:
Silvana tiene 36 años de edad estado civil unión libre, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.
Es integrante de ventanilla 30 de Noviembre que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto mina de piedra, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Silvana se dedica a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de gallinas.  Solicita el préstamo para  poder comprar los fertilizantes para la siembra para arrendar  terrenos además alimento para los animales como balanceados.  Las compras lo realiza en el cantón ventanas.   Su sueño es mejorar su cultivo y la producción para tener una mejor calidad de  vida. El desafío  que enfrenta es combatir contra la naturaleza.  En su tiempo libre le gusta tejer ropa de lana y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Silvana is 36 years old and in a common-law marriage. She lives with her husband and her two children in the canton of Ventanas, which is in the province of Los Ríos. She is a member fo the "30 de Noviembre" communal bank, which is located in the rural community of Mina de Piedra, which is also in Ventanas canton. She earns her living in farming and livestock production. 

Silvana grows corn and raises chickens. She is requesting this loan so that she can lease land, buy fertilizers for her crop, and buy pelleted feed for the animals. She makes her purchases in Ventanas canton.

Her dream is to improve her crops and her yield in order to have a better quality of life. The challenge that she faces is battling against nature. In her free time, she likes to knit wool clothing and spend time with her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides and pelleted animal feed.

loans.name: Jeddida

texts.en:
Jeddida, a 40-year-old single mother of three from Mwingi, earns a living for her family by operating a small retail shop. She has been unable to keep her shop fully stocked due to lack of investment capital. She has been operating the shop for the last eight years. 

This marks her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. Her business is only marginally sustainable because she is unable to expand it. Her goal is to fully stock her store in order to attract more customers and increase her profits. 

Jeddida is requesting for a loan from VisionFund Kenya in order to stock her shop with rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil and flour. With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, she will be able to improve the living conditions for her family and support the education of her three children. In the future, Jeddida plans to continue to invest in her business and to eventually operate a larger wholesale store.

loans.use: to stock her shop with rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Benadette

texts.en:
Benadette, a 36-year-old married mother of six from Thika, has a business as a mixed-crop farmer. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family. 

This marks her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya after clearing her previous loans successfully. She hopes to be able to purchase two dairy cows and pay school fees for her children. Additional income created will be ploughed back into the business and into buying food for the family. 

In the future, Benadette would like to offer her children quality education and to improve the living standards of the whole family. She hopes to expand her dairy farming.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows and pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Nay's Group

texts.en:
Nay is 27 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three children in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. All of her children are still in school. Nay and her husband are farmers who grow cassava. Having been in this business for nine years, together they earn about 25,000 KHR per day, of which they can save about 12,000 KHR after paying daily expenses. 

Nay’s group consists of two members who are in their second cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Nay has completely repaid her previous loan, which helped her improve her family’s living conditions. As group leader, Nay will use her portion of this loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her cassava and to pay labor fees. She hopes to grow her business and to make more crops to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is from Tsaghkaber village where she lives with her son. For over 25 years, Evelina has been running a farm. Specifically, her farm includes cows, sheep, pigs, and chickens as well as arable land where she cultivates wheat, potatoes and cabbage. Her son helps Evelina to sell the gathered harvest in the local open markets and earn an income for their living. As the only source of income, agriculture helps this family to cover their daily needs and sustain their living. Now, Evelina asks for this loan to purchase seeds, eight sheep and forage for feeding the livestock. This will help her to enlarge her farm and agribusiness. 

Evelina has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Evelina was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.
 
The loan is a hope for this family to overcome financial difficulties and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, sheep and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en: Marcel is 31 years old. He is a father of two, and his wife works as a farmer. He sells animals such as goats and cattle. He has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, he would like to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more goats and cattle for resale.

loans.name: Khachik

texts.en:
Khachik is from Gogaran Village of the Lori region. He is a farmer with 30 years of experience. He keeps livestock (cows, sheep, pigs, chickens) and cultivates potato, wheat, and grass. As the only breadwinner of the family, Khachik feels very responsible for earning a good income to cover his family's basic needs. Khachik has requested this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. As this is Khachik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

The loan will be a huge support for this farmer and his family, and they hope for your support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 35 years old. She is married with five children and they are all enrolled in school. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and beans to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and beans to resell.

loans.name: Kireku Development Group

texts.en:
Mable is a widow with four children, who lost her husband early in 2002, leaving her with the responsibility of caring for the young family, She is a hardworking lady who currently runs a lady’s salon from which she earns money for her household living.

She intends to expand it to a higher level and possibly shift to a bigger place where she can access many customers. However her biggest problem is limited capital which also limits her profits. She thanks the group members for standing by her in times of financial crisis.

loans.use: To buy hair products and cosmetics to sell in the beauty shop

loans.name: Tarieli

texts.en:
Tarieli, age 58, cultivates potatoes and maize on a plot of farmland to earn an income. He generates a small income by selling his produce to local traders. 

Tarieli lives in the Kvareli district. His wife lives abroad and his sons live in a different town.

In order to more effectively meet his daily costs, as well as to be in a position to offer more help to his sons, Tarieli has requested a loan. He received the credit within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo called "Start-up Program," which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

With his loan funds of 700 Gel, Tarieli will start a new clothing sales business. He will purchase clothing items at wholesale prices and sell them door-to-door in his community. His customers will be his co-workers, neighbors, and community members. Tarieli plans to sell a wide assortment of reasonably-priced clothing for men, women, and children. 

Though Tarieli expects this work to be hard at first, he is ready to deal with the initial difficulties and develop his trading business gradually. 

Tarieli relies on the goodwill of his lenders and highly appreciates their support.

loans.use: to purchasea  stock of clothing so that he can start trading

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Kwekwe, Zimbabwe. Beauty volunteers in schools as a Cama community health trainer spreading health information to school children and her community members. She is currently running a market gardening business which she started in April. One of her goals as a health trainer is to help people eat healthy foods and live healthy lives as well. The business has also allowed her to pay for school fees for two of her children and provide food for her family. She sells various types of vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, spinach, cassava, sweet potatoes, and carrots in her community. 

Beauty sees a good opportunity to grow her business since there are no fruit and vegetable shops in her area.  Beauty would like to use the loan to open her own vegetable shop and meet the needs of her community, and she also hopes to hire employees. This Kiva loan will give her a chance to take her enterprise to the next level.

loans.use: To cover the costs of opening a fruit and vegetable shop

loans.name: Tabitha  Wanjiru

texts.en:
Tabitha is a married mother of 3 and lives is Muranga County, central Kenya. Two of her children have completed high school while one is still in school. The two could not proceed to college due to financial constraints and now they have joined their mother in the farming business. The family depends on the 3 acre piece of land for agriculture and dairy farming to get income for their basic needs. They grow vegetables and cereal for their food, and fodder for their 5 cows.

After a training in their group about Biogas by VEP officials, Tabitha approached VEP to have a Biodigester constructed for her. All she would need is money and the expertise offered by VEP and many of her problems especially fuel problems would be solved. She now appreciates that money spent buying charcoal and kerosine can be saved, by using biogas for cooking and lighting. She will also practice organic farming by using bio-slurry which will lead to higher yield. This way she can have enough food for the family and probably sell some. With the savings and a little income she hopes her daughters can enroll in a college for a diploma course and this will give them a better future. For sure biogas will improve their livelihoods.

loans.use: to construct a biodigester

loans.name: Anita Guillermina

texts.es: Anita Guillermina, mayor de edad casada  originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsables con ganas de superación personal, Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo terminar sus estudios, debido a que tuvo que trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar,anteriormente se dedicaba a la compra venta de chatarra pero con el nuevo financiamiento decide poner una pulperia en su casa de habitación donde ofrece productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, salsa de tomate,aceite, arroz, frijoles, jugos, pan, huevos, sal, azúcar, leche, productos congelados, entre otros su jornada diaria empieza desde muy temprano al abrir su pulperia para atender a sus clientes . El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, detergentes, golosinas, papel higiénicos, productos congelados entre otros mas. Anita Guillermina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Anita Guillermina is originally from the municipality of Chinandega in the west of Nicaragaua.  She is a hard-working and responsible woman with a desire to get ahead.  Unfortunately, for financial reasons, Anita was unable to finish her education as she had to help with the household costs.  Previously Anita worked selling scrap metal but, with a new loan, she has decided to start a grocery store in her home where she will sell small quantities of household goods such as sachets of coffee and shampoo, tomato sauce, oil, rice, beans, juices, bread, eggs, salt, sugar, milk, frozen products and more.  Anita's day starts very early when she opens her grocery store to tend to her customers.  This loan will be used to invest in working capital and stock up her business with consumable goods such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, detergents, sweets, toilet paper, frozen goods, and more. Anita is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide to poor people in order for them to have a decent job and to poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy consumable goods such as rice, sugar, beans, frozen good, sweets, detergents, and more.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza was born in 1984 year at a village which is located in the south part of Tajikistan. She is not married. She used to meet her family's needs using her income from growing carrots and potatoes. 

She has been busy with this business more than ten years. She tries to develop the business and to attain more clients.  She has enough skill for her business. She wants to make a new sowing of vegetables and that’s why she is asking for a loan of 1500 USD: to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, and fuel, and to pay for rental workers.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, and fuel,  and to pay for rental workers

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
Nodira is 41 years old. She is married and has three children. Nodira has a higher pedagogical education. She works in a school as a teacher of history. Nodira’s husband is a master of repairing houses. 

They have a small income and that’s why they have not had an opportunity to repair their house. Nodira is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy building materials as cement and wood for repairing house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials as cement and wood for repairing her house

loans.name: Kulusum

texts.en: Kulusum  is married with five children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas.  She generates additional income from selling spare parts.  She works six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.  She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and to start going to villages to purchase her green bananas. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her monthly expenses  include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima earns an income by operating a restaurant business at the market. She has been engaged in her business for the past five years and works six days a week. She reports that her major challenges are transportation and fluctuating prices.

Halima is the sole breadwinner supporting her four children. The family lives in a house that has access to piped water and electricity. All four children attend school. Halima's primary monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Halima has requested a loan in the amount of 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO in order to buy cooking oil, flour, tomatoes, rice, green bananas, and sweet potatoes. 

Her goal for her business is eventually to buy a refrigerator so that she can start selling cold drinks.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, tomatoes, rice, green bananas, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Pilar Olenka

texts.es:
La socia Pilar olenka se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cerveza al por mayor y tambien la socia trabaja en una empresa como cajera,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de cerveza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cerveza al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Pilar Olenka continues to sell beer in quantity.  She also works as a cashier for another company.  She has had her beer business for several years and her dream is to grow it.  She is asking for a loan to buy beer in quantity.  She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a better second hand  car to start providing taxi in the province center

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to insulate her house and change old wooden windows into vacuum windows in order to reduce heat loss and renovate the wooden fence around the plot of land

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a 42-year-old mother who was gifted with five children. Her family currently resides in a rural community. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Annabelle helps her husband in generating income through a buy-and-sell business of fruits, vegetables and grocery items. 

She aims to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers’ demands, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is requesting additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy additional stock of fruits, vegetables and grocery items to sell. 

Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will make her business viable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruits, vegetables and grocery items to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a single, 23-year-old businessman in Thika. John operates a motorcycle transport business. He also operates a quarry and does mixed crop farming, businesses that supplement his monthly income. 

He has operated the motorcycle transport business for the past three years. He earns a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support himself and his mother. 

This marks his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya after repaying his previous loan successfully. With this loan, he will be able to purchase a new motorcycle. The additional income created will allow him to purchase quarrying equipment. 

In the future, John would like to get married and have children. His hopes are to buy a public service vehicle and become an established businessman.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
This is Ivy, 38, resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines, and a mother to her children. Her partner is Romeo, a mason. She, together with her partner, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Ivy operates a food stall. She sells barbecue, cooked eggs, mangoes, and other snacks. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like pork, chicken, eggs, mangoes, and other ingredients. 

Ivy hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of products like pork, chicken, eggs, mangoes, and other ingredients

loans.name: Jessica Alexandra

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 18 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos viv con los padres en casa de ellos,vive en en el Canton Mocache Perteneciente a la Provicncia de los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Sara Guerrero, perteneciente al Canton Mocache se dedican a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias.

Jessica se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz  y a la crianza de pollos. Las compras las realiza en Mocache en la feria de los dias Jueves.

Con el dinero ha podido cubrir algunas necesidades como el pago de la mano de obra y adquir algunos insumos.El credito solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos semillas y una bomba para fumigar. 

La meta es ahorrar dinero para cuando se case pueda comprar un terreno y construir la casa para la familia. Cuando tiene tiempo libre le gusta ver la televion de preferencia un programa que se llama calle 7.
texts.en:
